00066 /* If set to 1, will print verbose messages */
00067 int verbose = 0;

00069 /* Info structures for structures that can be dynamically allocated */
00070 static L_Alloc_Pool *Mparse_Item_pool = NULL;

00072 /* Flags whether or not the resource lists should be minimized */
00073 int minimize_res_lists = 0;
00074 
00075 /* Flags how many fatal parse errors there are */
00076 int fatal_parse_errors;
00077 
00078 /* Header file table */
00079 Header_File header_table[MAX_HEADER_FILES];
00080 int num_header_files = 0;

00087 /* Die with an error message if there has been any fatal errors so far */
00088 void
00089 Mdie_on_fatal_errors (Mparse_Info * pinfo)
00090 {
00091   /* Punt if fatal errors parsing this file */
00092   if (fatal_parse_errors > 0)
00093     {
00094       if (fatal_parse_errors == 1)
00095         {
00096           Mparse_error (pinfo, "Cannot continue: 1 parse error detected.");
00097         }
00098       else
00099         {
00100           Mparse_error (pinfo,
00101                         "Cannot continue: %d parse errors detected.",
00102                         fatal_parse_errors);
00103         }
00104     }
00105 }
00106 
00107 void
00108 Hbuild_environment_defines (Msymbol_Table * env_tab, char **envp)
00109 {
00110   int i;
00111   char *name_ptr, *value_ptr, *end_ptr, temp_val;
00112 
00113   for (i = 0; envp[i] != NULL; i++)
00114     {
00115       name_ptr = envp[i];
00116       value_ptr = envp[i];
00117 
00118       /* Scan to end of name */
00119       while ((*value_ptr != 0) && !isspace (*value_ptr) &&
00120              (*value_ptr != '='))
00121         value_ptr++;
00122 
00123       end_ptr = value_ptr;
00124 
00125       /* Scan to beginning of value */
00126       while (isspace (*value_ptr) || (*value_ptr == '='))
00127         value_ptr++;
00128 
00129       /* Save cahr at end_ptr so it can be restored later */
00130       temp_val = *end_ptr;
00131 
00132       /* Terminate the name */
00133       *end_ptr = 0;
00134 
00135       /* Do not pass the PATH variable to the hmdes.  This has caused
00136        * problems with the enviroment overwriting a $define.
00137        * Feel free to filter out any other trouble makers :)
00138        */
00139       if (strcmp (name_ptr, "PATH") != 0)
00140         {
00141           /* Insert define value into define table */
00142           Minsert_symbol (env_tab, name_ptr, strdup (value_ptr));
00143         }
00144 
00145       /* Restore the end_ptr so envp can be used by someone else */
00146       *end_ptr = temp_val;
00147     }
00148 }
00149 
00150 /*
00151  * Scans the command line passed to it for -Dmacro_name=macro_value
00152  * and builds a table of these 'command line defines' 
00153  */
00154 void
00155 Hbuild_command_line_defines (Msymbol_Table * cl_tab, char **argv)
00156 {
00157   int i;
00158   char *name_ptr, *value_ptr, *end_ptr, temp_val;
00159 
00160   for (i = 0; argv[i] != NULL; i++)
00161     {
00162       /* Be verbose if -verbose specified */
00163       if (strcmp (argv[i], "-verbose") == 0)
00164         {
00165           verbose = 1;
00166           continue;
00167         }
00168 
00169       /* Only process those that start with -D */
00170       if ((argv[i][0] != '-') || (argv[i][1] != 'D'))
00171         continue;
00172 
00173       name_ptr = &argv[i][2];
00174       value_ptr = &argv[i][2];
00175 
00176       /* Scan to end of name */
00177       while ((*value_ptr != 0) && !isspace (*value_ptr) &&
00178              (*value_ptr != '='))
00179         value_ptr++;
00180 
00181       end_ptr = value_ptr;
00182 
00183       /* Scan to beginning of value */
00184       while (isspace (*value_ptr) || (*value_ptr == '='))
00185         value_ptr++;
00186 
00187       /* Save cahr at end_ptr so it can be restored later */
00188       temp_val = *end_ptr;
00189 
00190       /* Terminate the name */
00191       *end_ptr = 0;
00192 
00193       /* Insert define value into define table */
00194       Minsert_symbol (cl_tab, name_ptr, strdup (value_ptr));
00195 
00196       /* Restore the end_ptr so argv can be used by someone else */
00197       *end_ptr = temp_val;
00198     }
00199 }
00200 
00201 Hmdes *
00202 create_hmdes (char *hmdes_file_name, char **argv, char **envp)
00203 {
00204   Mparse_Info *pinfo;
00205   char buf[MITEM_SIZE];
00206   Hmdes *hmdes;
00207 
00208   /* Intialize fatal_parse_error count */
00209   fatal_parse_errors = 0;
00210 
00211   /* Initialize alloc pools used */
00212   Mparse_Item_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("Mparse_Item",
00213                                           sizeof (Mparse_Item), 1);
00214 
00215   /* Create and initialize hmdes structure */
00216   if ((hmdes = (Hmdes *) malloc (sizeof (Hmdes))) == NULL)
00217     H_punt ("create_hmdes: Out of memory");
00218 
00219   /* Initialize hmdes structure */
00220   Malloc_name (&hmdes->file_name, hmdes_file_name);
00221   hmdes->processor_model = -1;
00222   hmdes->max_src_operands = -1;
00223   hmdes->max_src_syncs = -1;
00224   hmdes->max_dest_operands = -1;
00225   hmdes->max_dest_syncs = -1;
00226   hmdes->max_pred_operands = -1;
00227 
00228   pinfo = create_mparse_info (hmdes_file_name, hmdes);
00229 
00230   /* Create symbol tables */
00231   hmdes->defines_command = Mcreate_symbol_table ("Command line defined names",
00232                                                  MSYMBOL_TABLE_SIZE);
00233   hmdes->defines_environ = Mcreate_symbol_table ("Environment defined names",
00234                                                  MSYMBOL_TABLE_SIZE);
00235   hmdes->defines_internal = Mcreate_symbol_table ("Internal defined names",
00236                                                   MSYMBOL_TABLE_SIZE);
00237   hmdes->reg_file = Mcreate_symbol_table ("register files",
00238                                           MSYMBOL_TABLE_SIZE);
00239   hmdes->IO_sets = Mcreate_symbol_table ("IO sets", MSYMBOL_TABLE_SIZE);
00240   hmdes->IO_items = Mcreate_symbol_table ("IO items", MSYMBOL_TABLE_SIZE);
00241   hmdes->resources = Mcreate_symbol_table ("resources", MSYMBOL_TABLE_SIZE);
00242   hmdes->res_lists = Mcreate_symbol_table ("reservation tables",
00243                                            MSYMBOL_TABLE_SIZE);
00244   hmdes->latencies = Mcreate_symbol_table ("latencies", MSYMBOL_TABLE_SIZE);
00245   hmdes->op_class = Mcreate_symbol_table ("operation classes",
00246                                           MSYMBOL_TABLE_SIZE);
00247   hmdes->operations = Mcreate_symbol_table ("operations", MSYMBOL_TABLE_SIZE);
00248 
00249 
00250   if (Mget_next (pinfo, buf) == EOF)
00251     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Unexpected EOF");
00252 
00253   if (!Mmatch ("Version1", buf))
00254     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Version1 expected not '%s'", buf);
00255 
00256   /* Build table of command line parameters */
00257   if (argv != NULL)
00258     Hbuild_command_line_defines (hmdes->defines_command, argv);
00259 
00260   /* Build table of environment parameters */
00261   if (envp != NULL)
00262     Hbuild_environment_defines (hmdes->defines_environ, envp);
00263 
00264   hmdes_read_section (pinfo, "Define", hmdes_read_define);
00265   hmdes_read_section (pinfo, "Register_Files", hmdes_read_register_files);
00266   hmdes_read_section (pinfo, "IO_Sets", hmdes_read_IO_sets);
00267   hmdes_read_section (pinfo, "IO_Items", hmdes_read_IO_items);
00268   hmdes_read_section (pinfo, "Resources", hmdes_read_resources);
00269   hmdes_read_section (pinfo, "ResTables", hmdes_read_restables);
00270   hmdes_read_section (pinfo, "Latencies", hmdes_read_latencies);
00271   hmdes_read_section (pinfo, "Operation_Class", hmdes_read_operation_class);
00272   hmdes_read_section (pinfo, "Operations", hmdes_read_operations);
00273 
00274   if (Mget_next (pinfo, buf) != EOF)
00275     Mparse_error (pinfo, "EOF expected not '%s'", buf);
00276 
00277   /* Make error message pretty */
00278   strcpy (pinfo->section_name, "after Operations");
00279   Mdie_on_fatal_errors (pinfo);
00280 
00281 /*
00282     Mprint_symbol_table (stdout, hmdes->defines_command);
00283     Mprint_symbol_table (stdout, hmdes->defines_environ);
00284     Mprint_symbol_table (stdout, hmdes->defines_internal);
00285     Mprint_symbol_table (stdout, hmdes->reg_file);
00286     Mprint_symbol_table (stdout, hmdes->IO_sets);
00287     Mprint_symbol_table (stdout, hmdes->IO_items);
00288     Mprint_symbol_table (stdout, hmdes->resources);
00289     Mprint_symbol_table (stdout, hmdes->res_lists);
00290     Mprint_symbol_table (stdout, hmdes->latencies);
00291     Mprint_symbol_table (stdout, hmdes->op_class);
00292     Mprint_symbol_table (stdout, hmdes->operations);
00293 */
00294   L_free_alloc_pool (Mparse_Item_pool);
00295   return (hmdes);
00296 }
00297 
00298 void
00299 hmdes_read_section (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *name, void (*func) ())
00300 {
00301   char buf1[MITEM_SIZE];
00302   char buf2[MITEM_SIZE];
00303   char buf3[MITEM_SIZE];
00304 
00305   /* Update where we are */
00306   sprintf (pinfo->section_name, "before %s", name);
00307 
00308   if ((Mget_next (pinfo, buf1) == EOF) ||
00309       (Mget_next (pinfo, buf2) == EOF) || (Mget_next (pinfo, buf3) == EOF))
00310     {
00311       Mparse_error (pinfo, "Unexpected EOF");
00312     }
00313 
00314   if ((!Mmatch ("(", buf1)) ||
00315       (!Mmatch (name, buf2)) || (!Mmatch ("declaration", buf3)))
00316     {
00317       Mparse_error (pinfo,
00318                     "'( %s declaration' expected not '%s %s %s'",
00319                     name, buf1, buf2, buf3);
00320     }
00321   /* Update where we are */
00322   sprintf (pinfo->section_name, "%s", name);
00323 
00324   /* Read the section */
00325   func (pinfo, name);
00326 
00327   /* Update where we are */
00328   sprintf (pinfo->section_name, "after %s", name);
00329 }
00330 
00331 void
00332 hmdes_read_define (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *sname)
00333 {
00334   Hmdes *hmdes;
00335   char buf[MITEM_SIZE];
00336 
00337   /* Get hmdes for easy use */
00338   hmdes = pinfo->hmdes;
00339 
00340   while (!hmdes_section_end (pinfo))
00341     {
00342       if (mread_proc_model (pinfo, "processor_model",
00343                             &hmdes->processor_model) ||
00344           mread_define_var (pinfo, "source_operands",
00345                             &hmdes->max_src_operands) ||
00346           mread_define_var (pinfo, "src_syncs",
00347                             &hmdes->max_src_syncs) ||
00348           mread_define_var (pinfo, "dest_operands",
00349                             &hmdes->max_dest_operands) ||
00350           mread_define_var (pinfo, "dest_syncs",
00351                             &hmdes->max_dest_syncs) ||
00352           mread_define_var (pinfo, "predicates", &hmdes->max_pred_operands))
00353         {
00354           continue;
00355         }
00356 
00357       /* If declaring header file to scan, read it in here */
00358       else if (Mis_next (pinfo, "C_header_file"))
00359         {
00360           /* Read header file declarer */
00361           Mread_match (pinfo, "C_header_file");
00362 
00363           /* Read header file location */
00364           if (Mget_next (pinfo, buf) == EOF)
00365             H_punt ("Unexpected EOF reading header file");
00366 
00367           if (num_header_files >= (MAX_HEADER_FILES - 1))
00368             H_punt ("Too many header files declared, max %i",
00369                     MAX_HEADER_FILES);
00370 
00371           /* Get the header file's name */
00372           Malloc_name (&header_table[num_header_files].name, buf);
00373 
00374           /* Print what we are doing */
00375           if (verbose)
00376             {
00377               printf ("Reading %s:\n", buf);
00378             }
00379 
00380           /* Read in the header file into a symbol table */
00381           header_table[num_header_files].table = Hread_header_file (buf);
00382 
00383           num_header_files++;
00384         }
00385       /* Unknown variable, print error message */
00386       else
00387         {
00388           Mpeek_ahead (pinfo, 0, buf);
00389           Mparse_error (pinfo, "Unknown define var '%s'", buf);
00390         }
00391     }
00392 
00393   /* Check all define variables to make sure they were defined */
00394   if (hmdes->processor_model < 0)
00395     Mparse_fatal (pinfo,
00396                   "'processor_model' must be specified (superscalar or VLIW)");
00397   if (hmdes->max_src_operands < 0)
00398     Mparse_fatal (pinfo, "'source_operands' must be specified");
00399   if (hmdes->max_src_syncs < 0)
00400     Mparse_fatal (pinfo, "'src_syncs' must be specified");
00401   if (hmdes->max_dest_operands < 0)
00402     Mparse_fatal (pinfo, "'dest_operands' must be specified");
00403   if (hmdes->max_dest_syncs < 0)
00404     Mparse_fatal (pinfo, "'dest_syncs' must be specified");
00405   if (hmdes->max_pred_operands < 0)
00406     Mparse_fatal (pinfo, "'predicates' must be specified");
00407 
00408   /* Warn if don't have enough sync operands for the dependence graph */
00409   if ((hmdes->max_src_syncs < 3) || (hmdes->max_dest_syncs < 3))
00410     Mparse_warn (pinfo,
00411                  "The dependence graph requires at least 3 src/dest syncs\n");
00412 
00413   /* Die now if there has been a fatal error */
00414   Mdie_on_fatal_errors (pinfo);
00415 
00416   return;
00417 }
00418 
00419 /* Peeks at the next item, returns 1 if a name, 0 otherwise */
00420 int
00421 Mis_name_next (Mparse_Info * pinfo)
00422 {
00423   char buf[MITEM_SIZE];
00424   if (Mpeek_ahead (pinfo, 0, buf) == EOF)
00425     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Unexpected EOF");
00426 
00427   if (isalpha (buf[0]) || (buf[0] == '_'))
00428     return (1);
00429   else
00430     return (0);
00431 }
00432 
00433 /* Returns 1 if str matches what is next in the parse stream, 0 otherwise */
00434 int
00435 Mis_next (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *str)
00436 {
00437   char buf[MITEM_SIZE];
00438   if (Mpeek_ahead (pinfo, 0, buf) == EOF)
00439     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Unexpected EOF");
00440 
00441   return (Mmatch (buf, str));
00442 }
00443 
00444 /* Reads a name into buf (must be MITEM_SIZE long).
00445  * May be a single '-' signifying no entry
00446  * Punts if not a name or a '-'
00447  */
00448 void
00449 Mread_name (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *name, char *desc)
00450 {
00451   if (Mget_next (pinfo, name) == EOF)
00452     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Unexpected EOF");
00453 
00454   if (!(isalpha (name[0]) || (name[0] == '_') || Mmatch ("-", name)))
00455     Mparse_error (pinfo, "%s name expected not '%s'", desc, name);
00456 }
00457 
00458 /*
00459  * Read the next name and finds it in the passed symbol table.
00460  * If '-' is next, NULL is put in ptr.
00461  * Puts structure for name in ptr.  Punts on error.
00462  */
00463 void
00464 Mread_symbol (Mparse_Info * pinfo, Msymbol_Table * table, void **ptr,
00465               char *desc)
00466 {
00467   char name[MITEM_SIZE];
00468 
00469   Mread_name (pinfo, name, desc);
00470 
00471   /* If have '-', set ptr to NULL */
00472   if (Mmatch (name, "-"))
00473     *ptr = NULL;
00474   else
00475     {
00476       if ((*ptr = Mfind_symbol (table, name)) == NULL)
00477         Mparse_error (pinfo, "'%s' not found in %s symbol table", name,
00478                       table->name);
00479     }
00480 
00481 }
00482 
00483 /*
00484  * Read the next name and finds it in the passed symbol table.
00485  * If the terminator is next, it is left in parse stream and hmdes->null_set
00486  * is put in ptr.
00487  * If '-' is next, the '-' is read and hmdes->null_set is put in ptr.
00488  * Puts structure for name in ptr.  Punts on error.
00489  */
00490 void
00491 Mread_IO_item_symbol (Mparse_Info * pinfo, Msymbol_Table * table, void **ptr,
00492                       char *terminator)
00493 {
00494   if (Mis_next (pinfo, terminator))
00495     *ptr = pinfo->hmdes->null_set;
00496   else if (Mis_next (pinfo, "-"))
00497     {
00498       Mread_match (pinfo, "-");
00499       *ptr = pinfo->hmdes->null_set;
00500     }
00501   else
00502     Mread_symbol (pinfo, table, ptr, "IO set or register file");
00503 }
00504 
00505 
00506 /* Reads the next item and punts if doesn't match str */
00507 void
00508 Mread_match (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *str)
00509 {
00510   char buf[MITEM_SIZE];
00511 
00512   if (Mget_next (pinfo, buf) == EOF)
00513     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Unexpected EOF.  Expecting '%s'", str);
00514 
00515   if (!Mmatch (str, buf))
00516     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Expecting '%s' not '%s'", str, buf);
00517 }
00518 
00519 /* For debugging, reads in and throws away a set */
00520 int
00521 mscan_set (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *name)
00522 {
00523   int level;
00524   char buf[MITEM_SIZE];
00525 
00526   level = 0;
00527   if (Mget_next (pinfo, buf) == EOF)
00528     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Unexpected EOF.  Expected set for %s", name);
00529 
00530   if (!Mmatch ("(", buf))
00531     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Expected set opening '(' not '%s'", buf);
00532 
00533   level = 1;
00534 
00535   while (level > 0)
00536     {
00537       if (Mget_next (pinfo, buf) == EOF)
00538         Mparse_error (pinfo, "Unexpected EOF in %s definition", name);
00539 
00540       if (Mmatch ("(", buf))
00541         level++;
00542       else if (Mmatch (")", buf))
00543         level--;
00544     }
00545 
00546   return 0;
00547 }
00548 
00549 int
00550 mread_proc_model (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *name, int *ptr)
00551 {
00552   char model[MITEM_SIZE];
00553 
00554   /* If name matches, read the variable name and its value */
00555   if (Mis_next (pinfo, name))
00556     {
00557       /* Skip name */
00558       Mread_match (pinfo, name);
00559 
00560       /* Read processor model string */
00561       if (Mget_next (pinfo, model) == EOF)
00562         {
00563           Mparse_error (pinfo,
00564                         "Unexpected EOF. Expecting model name for '%s'",
00565                         name);
00566         }
00567 
00568       /* Non-case sensitive string compare */
00569       if (Mmatch (model, "superscalar"))
00570         *ptr = MDES_SUPERSCALAR;
00571       else if (Mmatch (model, "vliw"))
00572         *ptr = MDES_VLIW;
00573       else
00574         Mparse_error (pinfo,
00575                       "Undefined processor model '%s'.  "
00576                       "Use superscalar or VLIW.", model);
00577 
00578       /* Return 1 since read in variable */
00579       return (1);
00580     }
00581 
00582   /* Return 0, variable not read in */
00583   return (0);
00584 }
00585 
00586 int
00587 mread_define_var (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *name, int *ptr)
00588 {
00589   /* If name matches, read the variable name and its value */
00590   if (Mis_next (pinfo, name))
00591     {
00592       /* Skip name */
00593       Mread_match (pinfo, name);
00594 
00595       /* Read variable value */
00596       if (Mread_int (pinfo, ptr) == EOF)
00597         {
00598           Mparse_error (pinfo,
00599                         "Unexpected EOF. Expecting int value for '%s'", name);
00600         }
00601 
00602       /* Make sure value read is not < 0 */
00603       if (*ptr < 0)
00604         Mparse_error (pinfo, "%s value must be >= 0, not %i", name, *ptr);
00605 
00606       /* Return 1 since read in variable */
00607       return (1);
00608     }
00609 
00610   /* Return 0, variable not read in */
00611   return (0);
00612 }
00613 
00614 void
00615 Malloc_struct (void **ptr, int size)
00616 {
00617   if ((*ptr = (void *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
00618     H_punt ("Malloc_struct: Out of memory");
00619 }
00620 
00621 void
00622 Malloc_name (char **ptr, char *name)
00623 {
00624   int size;
00625   size = strlen (name) + 1;
00626   if ((*ptr = (char *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
00627     H_punt ("Malloc_name: Out of memory");
00628 
00629   strcpy (*ptr, name);
00630 }
00631 
00632 /*
00633  * Reads an integer into *ptr from the file.  
00634  * 
00635  * Returns 0 on success, EOF if at end of file.
00636  */
00637 int
00638 Mread_int (Mparse_Info * pinfo, int *ptr)
00639 {
00640   char buf[MITEM_SIZE];
00641   char *end_ptr;
00642 
00643   if (Mget_next (pinfo, buf) == EOF)
00644     return (EOF);
00645 
00646   /* Make sure read in number */
00647   if ((!isdigit (buf[0])) && (buf[0] != '-'))
00648     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Int value expected, not '%s'", buf);
00649 
00650   /* Write int value to *ptr */
00651   *ptr = strtol (buf, &end_ptr, 0);
00652 
00653   /* Make sure number was converted properly */
00654   if (*end_ptr != 0)
00655     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Error converting '%s' to an integer", buf);
00656 
00657   /* Return success */
00658   return (0);
00659 }
00660 
00661 Msymbol_Table *
00662 Mcreate_symbol_table (char *name, int size)
00663 {
00664   Msymbol_Table *table;
00665   int name_size, table_size, hash_size;
00666   int i;
00667 
00668   /* Make sure size is a power of two */
00669   for (i = 0; i < 32; i++)
00670     {
00671       /* Shift left until find first 1 */
00672       if (((size >> i) & 1) == 1)
00673         {
00674           /* If this is the only 1, then power of two */
00675           if ((size >> i) == 1)
00676             break;
00677           else
00678             H_punt ("Create_symbol_table: %s size (%i) must be power of 2",
00679                     name, size);
00680         }
00681     }
00682   table_size = sizeof (Msymbol_Table);
00683   name_size = strlen (name) + 1;
00684   hash_size = size * sizeof (Msymbol *);
00685 
00686   if (((table = (Msymbol_Table *) malloc (table_size)) == NULL) ||
00687       ((table->name = (char *) malloc (name_size)) == NULL) ||
00688       ((table->hash_table = (Msymbol **) malloc (hash_size)) == NULL))
00689     {
00690       H_punt ("Create_symbol_table: Out of memory");
00691     }
00692 
00693   /* Intialize symbol table values */
00694   strcpy (table->name, name);
00695   table->hash_mask = size - 1;
00696   table->head = NULL;
00697   table->tail = NULL;
00698   table->entry_count = 0;
00699 
00700   for (i = 0; i < size; i++)
00701     table->hash_table[i] = NULL;
00702 
00703   return (table);
00704 }
00705 
00706 /* 
00707  * Finds the data structure associated with name in the symbol table.
00708  * Returns a pointer to the structure or NULL if it cannot be 
00709  * found.
00710  */
00711 void *
00712 Mfind_symbol (Msymbol_Table * table, char *name)
00713 {
00714   Msymbol *symbol;
00715   unsigned int hash_val;
00716 
00717   hash_val = Mhash_name (name, table->hash_mask);
00718   symbol = table->hash_table[hash_val];
00719 
00720   while (symbol != NULL)
00721     {
00722       /* Case sensitive */
00723       if (strcmp (symbol->name, name) == 0)
00724         return (symbol->ptr);
00725 
00726       symbol = symbol->next_hash;
00727     }
00728   return (NULL);
00729 }
00730 
00731 /*
00732  * Creates and insert a symbol with 'name' that points to 'ptr'.
00733  * 
00734  */
00735 void
00736 Minsert_unique_symbol (Mparse_Info * pinfo, Msymbol_Table * table, char *name,
00737                        void *ptr)
00738 {
00739   /* Do not allow '-' to be added to symbol table */
00740   if (Mmatch ("-", name))
00741     Mparse_error (pinfo, "'-' is not a valid symbol name",
00742                   pinfo->section_name);
00743 
00744   /* Make sure symbol does not already exist */
00745   if (Mfind_symbol (table, name) != NULL)
00746     Mparse_error (pinfo, "redefinition of '%s'", name);
00747 
00748   Minsert_symbol (table, name, ptr);
00749 }
00750 
00751 void
00752 Minsert_symbol (Msymbol_Table * table, char *name, void *ptr)
00753 {
00754   Msymbol *symbol;
00755   unsigned int hash_val;
00756   int symbol_size, name_size;
00757 
00758   /* Allocate symbol and name space */
00759   symbol_size = sizeof (Msymbol);
00760   name_size = strlen (name) + 1;
00761 
00762   if (((symbol = (Msymbol *) malloc (symbol_size)) == NULL) ||
00763       ((symbol->name = (char *) malloc (name_size)) == NULL))
00764     {
00765       H_punt ("Msymbol_table: Out of memory");
00766     }
00767 
00768   /* Copy info to symbol */
00769   strcpy (symbol->name, name);
00770   symbol->ptr = ptr;
00771 
00772   /* Link into hash table */
00773   hash_val = Mhash_name (name, table->hash_mask);
00774   symbol->next_hash = table->hash_table[hash_val];
00775   table->hash_table[hash_val] = symbol;
00776 
00777   /* Link into linear list of symbols */
00778   symbol->prev_linear = table->tail;
00779   symbol->next_linear = NULL;
00780   if (table->tail == NULL)
00781     table->head = symbol;
00782   else
00783     table->tail->next_linear = symbol;
00784   table->tail = symbol;
00785 
00786   /* Increment table entry count */
00787   table->entry_count++;
00788 }
00789 
00790 /* 
00791  * Prints a list of names defined to a file
00792  */
00793 void
00794 Mprint_symbol_table (FILE * out, Msymbol_Table * table)
00795 {
00796   Msymbol *symbol;
00797 
00798   fprintf (out, "Symbol table for '%s' has %i entries:\n", table->name,
00799            table->entry_count);
00800 
00801   for (symbol = table->head; symbol != NULL; symbol = symbol->next_linear)
00802     fprintf (out, "%s\n", symbol->name);
00803 
00804   fprintf (out, "\n");
00805 }
00806 
00807 /*
00808  * Hashes the name and limits using mask.
00809  * This quick function is not a great hash function but it works
00810  * well enough (doing normal modulus algorithms is just too expensive).
00811  */
00812 int
00813 Mhash_name (char *name, int mask)
00814 {
00815   unsigned int accum, hash_val;
00816 
00817   accum = 0;
00818 
00819   while (*name != 0)
00820     {
00821       accum <<= 1;
00822       accum += *name;
00823       name++;
00824     }
00825 
00826   hash_val = accum & mask;
00827 
00828   return (hash_val);
00829 }
00830 
00831 /*
00832  * Gets the int value declared in the header files for the specified name 
00833  * and puts it into ptr. 
00834  * 
00835  * Returns 1 if found.
00836  * Returns 0 if not found.
00837  * Returns -1 if has bad value or multiply defined (prints warnings).
00838  * 
00839  * Sets ptr value to -1 if not found.
00840  */
00841 int
00842 find_header_value (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *name, int *ptr)
00843 {
00844   Msymbol_Table *prev_def;
00845   int i;
00846   char *val_str, *end_ptr;
00847   char *prev_str;
00848   int prev_val;
00849 
00850   prev_def = NULL;
00851   prev_val = -1;
00852   prev_str = NULL;
00853 
00854   /* Search all header files for symbol */
00855   for (i = 0; i < num_header_files; i++)
00856     {
00857       val_str = Mfind_symbol (header_table[i].table, name);
00858 
00859       if (val_str == NULL)
00860         continue;
00861 
00862       /* Try to convert to an int */
00863       *ptr = strtol (val_str, &end_ptr, 0);
00864 
00865       if (*end_ptr != 0)
00866         {
00867           Mparse_fatal (pinfo,
00868                         "%s value '%s' from %s is not an int\n",
00869                         name, val_str, header_table[i].table->name);
00870           *ptr = -1;
00871           return (-1);
00872         }
00873 
00874       if (prev_def == NULL)
00875         {
00876           prev_def = header_table[i].table;
00877           prev_val = *ptr;
00878           prev_str = val_str;
00879         }
00880       else
00881         {
00882           if (prev_val != *ptr)
00883             {
00884               Mparse_fatal (pinfo,
00885                             "Reading %s, %s defines as %s, %s defines as %s\n",
00886                             name, header_table[i].table->name,
00887                             val_str, prev_def->name, prev_str);
00888               *ptr = -1;
00889               return (-1);
00890             }
00891         }
00892     }
00893 
00894   /* If found, return 1, else 0 */
00895   if (prev_def != NULL)
00896     return (1);
00897   else
00898     {
00899       *ptr = -1;
00900       return (0);
00901     }
00902 }
00903 void
00904 hmdes_read_register_files (Mparse_Info * pinfo)
00905 {
00906   Hmdes *hmdes;
00907   Hmdes_Reg_File *reg;
00908   char name[MITEM_SIZE];
00909   char var[MITEM_SIZE];
00910   char header_name[MITEM_SIZE + 20];
00911   int reg_id;
00912   int ret_val;
00913 
00914   /* Print out explanation of external id's */
00915   if (verbose)
00916     {
00917       printf
00918         ("#The lmdes C interface uses the following optional external ids:\n");
00919     }
00920 
00921   /* Get hmdes for easy use */
00922   hmdes = pinfo->hmdes;
00923   reg_id = 0;
00924   while (!hmdes_section_end (pinfo))
00925     {
00926       /* Read in reg file name */
00927       Mread_name (pinfo, name, "Register file");
00928 
00929       /* Allocate space for structure and name */
00930       Malloc_struct ((void **) &reg, sizeof (Hmdes_Reg_File));
00931       Malloc_name (&reg->name, name);
00932 
00933       /* Number the registers from 0 */
00934       reg->id = reg_id;
00935 
00936       /* Read external id for this register file */
00937       sprintf (header_name, "MDES_OPERAND_%s", reg->name);
00938       ret_val = find_header_value (pinfo, header_name, &reg->external_id);
00939 
00940       /* If could not get value, set to -1 */
00941       if (ret_val != 1)
00942         {
00943           reg->external_id = -1;
00944           if (verbose)
00945             {
00946               fprintf (stdout,
00947                        "Register file %-11s not mapped to an external id\n",
00948                        reg->name);
00949             }
00950 
00951           /* NULL must be mapped to external id */
00952           if (strcmp (reg->name, "NULL") == 0)
00953             Mparse_error (pinfo,
00954                           "NULL register file must have an external id");
00955 
00956         }
00957       else
00958         {
00959           if (verbose)
00960             {
00961               fprintf (stdout,
00962                        "Register file %-11s mapped to %2i\n",
00963                        reg->name, reg->external_id);
00964             }
00965         }
00966 
00967       /* Parse  'name ((capacity 192 0) (width 32))' */
00968       Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
00969 
00970       /* Read capacity */
00971       Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
00972       Mread_name (pinfo, var, "capacity");
00973       if (!Mmatch ("capacity", var))
00974         Mparse_error (pinfo, "'capacity' expected not '%s'", var);
00975       Mread_int (pinfo, &reg->static_regs);
00976       Mread_int (pinfo, &reg->rotating_regs);
00977       Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
00978 
00979       /* Read width */
00980       Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
00981       Mread_name (pinfo, var, "width");
00982       if (!Mmatch ("width", var))
00983         Mparse_error (pinfo, "'width' expected not '%s'", var);
00984       Mread_int (pinfo, &reg->width);
00985       Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
00986 
00987       Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
00988 
00989       Minsert_unique_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->reg_file, reg->name, reg);
00990       /* Increment register id */
00991       reg_id++;
00992     }
00993 
00994   /* 
00995    * Make sure a NULL register file is declared.  All - and default
00996    * IO_sets will point at this register file
00997    */
00998   if (Mfind_symbol (hmdes->reg_file, "NULL") == NULL)
00999     Mparse_error (pinfo, "NULL register file must be explicitly declared");
01000 
01001   return;
01002 }
01003 
01004 void
01005 Madd_IO_node (Hmdes_IO_Set * IO_set, Hmdes_Reg_File * reg_file)
01006 {
01007   Hmdes_IO_Node *IO_node;
01008 
01009   Malloc_struct ((void **) (&IO_node), sizeof (Hmdes_IO_Node));
01010   IO_node->reg_file = reg_file;
01011   IO_node->next = NULL;
01012 
01013   /* Add to end of IO_set list */
01014   if (IO_set->tail == NULL)
01015     IO_set->head = IO_node;
01016   else
01017     IO_set->tail->next = IO_node;
01018   IO_set->tail = IO_node;
01019   IO_set->size++;
01020 
01021 }
01022 
01023 void
01024 hmdes_read_IO_sets (Mparse_Info * pinfo)
01025 {
01026   Hmdes *hmdes;
01027   Msymbol *symbol;
01028   Hmdes_Reg_File *reg_file;
01029   Hmdes_IO_Set *IO_set, *c_set;
01030   Hmdes_IO_Node *IO_node;
01031   char set_name[MITEM_SIZE];
01032   char header_name[MITEM_SIZE + 20];
01033   int IO_set_id;
01034   int ret_val;
01035 
01036   /* Get hmdes for easy use */
01037   hmdes = pinfo->hmdes;
01038 
01039   /* Intialize counter so we can set IO_sets_id's for lmdes */
01040   IO_set_id = 0;
01041 
01042   /* 
01043    * Add all register files as IO_Sets to the IO_Set symbol
01044    * table so there is a uniform interface to IO_Sets.
01045    * This also allows IO_Sets to be made up of IO_Sets.
01046    */
01047   for (symbol = hmdes->reg_file->head; symbol != NULL;
01048        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
01049     {
01050       /* Get register file */
01051       reg_file = (Hmdes_Reg_File *) symbol->ptr;
01052 
01053       /* Create set to hold register file with it's name */
01054       Malloc_struct ((void **) (&IO_set), sizeof (Hmdes_IO_Set));
01055       Malloc_name (&IO_set->name, reg_file->name);
01056       IO_set->id = IO_set_id;
01057       IO_set->external_id = reg_file->external_id;
01058       IO_set->head = NULL;
01059       IO_set->tail = NULL;
01060       IO_set->size = 0;
01061 
01062       /* Make sure IO_set_id is the same as reg_id */
01063       if (IO_set_id != reg_file->id)
01064         H_punt ("hmdes_read_IO_sets: IO_set_id (%i) != reg_id (%i)",
01065                 IO_set_id, reg_file->id);
01066 
01067       /* Add the register file to IO_set */
01068       Madd_IO_node (IO_set, reg_file);
01069 
01070       /* Add IO_set to symbol table */
01071       Minsert_unique_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->IO_sets, IO_set->name, IO_set);
01072 
01073       /* Increment IO_set_id */
01074       IO_set_id++;
01075     }
01076 
01077   while (!hmdes_section_end (pinfo))
01078     {
01079       Mread_name (pinfo, set_name, "IO set");
01080 
01081       Malloc_struct ((void **) (&IO_set), sizeof (Hmdes_IO_Set));
01082       Malloc_name (&IO_set->name, set_name);
01083       IO_set->id = IO_set_id;
01084       IO_set->head = NULL;
01085       IO_set->tail = NULL;
01086       IO_set->size = 0;
01087 
01088       /* Read external id for this IO_Set */
01089       sprintf (header_name, "MDES_OPERAND_%s", IO_set->name);
01090       ret_val = find_header_value (pinfo, header_name, &IO_set->external_id);
01091 
01092       /* If could get value, set to -1 */
01093       if (ret_val != 1)
01094         {
01095           IO_set->external_id = -1;
01096           if (verbose)
01097             {
01098               fprintf (stdout,
01099                        "IO_Set        %-11s not mapped to an external id\n",
01100                        IO_set->name);
01101             }
01102 
01103         }
01104       else
01105         {
01106           if (verbose)
01107             {
01108               fprintf (stdout, "IO_Set        %-11s mapped to %2i\n",
01109                        IO_set->name, IO_set->external_id);
01110             }
01111         }
01112 
01113       Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
01114 
01115       while (Mis_name_next (pinfo))
01116         {
01117           /* Find the IO_Set that goes with this name */
01118           Mread_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->IO_sets, (void **) (&c_set), "IO set");
01119 
01120           /* Add all it's reg files to this IO_set */
01121           for (IO_node = c_set->head; IO_node != NULL;
01122                IO_node = IO_node->next)
01123             {
01124               Madd_IO_node (IO_set, IO_node->reg_file);
01125             }
01126         }
01127 
01128       Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
01129 
01130       /* May not have empty IO_Sets.  This is what the NULL IO_Set is 
01131        * use for.
01132        */
01133       if (IO_set->size == 0)
01134         Mparse_error (pinfo,
01135                       "Empty IO_Set declaration (%s).  Use NULL.",
01136                       IO_set->name);
01137 
01138       Minsert_unique_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->IO_sets, IO_set->name, IO_set);
01139       /* Increment IO_set_id */
01140       IO_set_id++;
01141     }
01142 
01143   /* 
01144    * Get the null_set to use every where - and where IO_set needs
01145    * to default to something
01146    */
01147   hmdes->null_set = (Hmdes_IO_Set *) Mfind_symbol (hmdes->IO_sets, "NULL");
01148 
01149   /* Should never be NULL */
01150   if (hmdes->null_set == NULL)
01151     H_punt ("No NULL IO_set, should have been detected earlier");
01152 
01153   return;
01154 }
01155 
01156 void
01157 hmdes_read_IO_items (Mparse_Info * pinfo)
01158 {
01159   Hmdes *hmdes;
01160   Hmdes_IO_Item *IO_item;
01161   char item_name[MITEM_SIZE];
01162   int array_size, i;
01163   int item_id;
01164 
01165   /* Get hmdes for easy use */
01166   hmdes = pinfo->hmdes;
01167 
01168   /* Intialize item id */
01169   item_id = 0;
01170 
01171   /* Get size of IO_item src, dest and pred array */
01172   array_size = sizeof (Hmdes_IO_Set *) * (hmdes->max_src_operands +
01173                                           hmdes->max_dest_operands +
01174                                           hmdes->max_pred_operands);
01175 
01176   while (!hmdes_section_end (pinfo))
01177     {
01178       /* Read name of IO_item and alloc IO_item */
01179       Mread_name (pinfo, item_name, "IO item");
01180       Malloc_struct ((void **) (&IO_item), sizeof (Hmdes_IO_Item));
01181       Malloc_name (&IO_item->name, item_name);
01182 
01183       /* Set item id */
01184       IO_item->id = item_id;
01185 
01186       /*
01187        * Alloc array for src, dest and pred IO_sets in one block
01188        * and break into pieces
01189        */
01190       Malloc_struct ((void **) (&IO_item->src), array_size);
01191       IO_item->dest = &IO_item->src[hmdes->max_src_operands];
01192       IO_item->pred = &IO_item->dest[hmdes->max_dest_operands];
01193 
01194       /* read '(<predicate0 ...>[dest0 ...][src0 ...])' */
01195       Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
01196 
01197       /* If '<' next, then optional predicate field is defined */
01198       if (Mis_next (pinfo, "<"))
01199         {
01200           Mread_match (pinfo, "<");
01201           for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_pred_operands; i++)
01202             Mread_IO_item_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->IO_sets,
01203                                   (void **) (&IO_item->pred[i]), ">");
01204           Mread_match (pinfo, ">");
01205         }
01206       /* Otherwise, set all predicates to NULL */
01207       else
01208         {
01209           for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_pred_operands; i++)
01210             IO_item->pred[i] = hmdes->null_set;
01211         }
01212 
01213       /* Read in dests */
01214       Mread_match (pinfo, "[");
01215       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_dest_operands; i++)
01216         Mread_IO_item_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->IO_sets,
01217                               (void **) (&IO_item->dest[i]), "]");
01218       Mread_match (pinfo, "]");
01219 
01220       /* Read in srcs */
01221       Mread_match (pinfo, "[");
01222       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_src_operands; i++)
01223         Mread_IO_item_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->IO_sets,
01224                               (void **) (&IO_item->src[i]), "]");
01225       Mread_match (pinfo, "]");
01226 
01227 
01228       Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
01229 
01230       Minsert_unique_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->IO_items, IO_item->name, IO_item);
01231 
01232       /* Update item_id */
01233       item_id++;
01234     }
01235   return;
01236 }
01237 
01238 /*
01239  * Adds the subscript to the resource subscript list
01240  */
01241 void
01242 hmdes_add_res_subscript (Mparse_Info * pinfo, Hmdes_Resource * resource,
01243                          int subscript, int id)
01244 {
01245   Hmdes_Res_Sub *sub, *new_sub;
01246 
01247   /* Search subscript list for duplicate, punt if found */
01248   for (sub = resource->head; sub != NULL; sub = sub->next)
01249     {
01250       if (sub->subscript == subscript)
01251         Mparse_error (pinfo, "Duplicate subscript decl %i for '%s'",
01252                       subscript, resource->name);
01253     }
01254 
01255   Malloc_struct ((void **) &new_sub, sizeof (Hmdes_Res_Node));
01256 
01257   new_sub->resource = resource;
01258   new_sub->id = id;
01259   new_sub->subscript = subscript;
01260   new_sub->next = NULL;
01261   if (resource->tail == NULL)
01262     resource->head = new_sub;
01263   else
01264     resource->tail->next = new_sub;
01265   resource->tail = new_sub;
01266   resource->num_subscripts++;
01267 }
01268 
01269 void
01270 hmdes_read_resources (Mparse_Info * pinfo)
01271 {
01272   Hmdes *hmdes;
01273   Hmdes_Resource *resource;
01274   Hmdes_Res_Sub *slot_sub;
01275   int start_subscript;
01276   int end_subscript;
01277   int subscript;
01278   char res_name[MITEM_SIZE];
01279   int res_id;
01280   int i;
01281 
01282   /* Get hmdes for easy use */
01283   hmdes = pinfo->hmdes;
01284 
01285   /* Initiailize enumeration of resources */
01286   res_id = 0;
01287   while (!hmdes_section_end (pinfo))
01288     {
01289       Mread_name (pinfo, res_name, "Resource");
01290       Malloc_struct ((void **) (&resource), sizeof (Hmdes_Resource));
01291       Malloc_name (&resource->name, res_name);
01292       resource->head = NULL;
01293       resource->tail = NULL;
01294       resource->num_subscripts = 0;
01295 
01296       /* If declaration includes subscripts, read them */
01297       if (Mis_next (pinfo, "["))
01298         {
01299           Mread_match (pinfo, "[");
01300 
01301           /* Make sure not empty [] */
01302           if (Mis_next (pinfo, "]"))
01303             Mparse_error (pinfo, "Empty [] not allowed");
01304 
01305           /* Loop until ending ] to read in subscripts */
01306           while (!Mis_next (pinfo, "]"))
01307             {
01308               /* Get lower bound on subscript */
01309               Mread_int (pinfo, &start_subscript);
01310 
01311               /* If followed by .., ready end_subscript */
01312               if (Mis_next (pinfo, ".."))
01313                 {
01314                   Mread_match (pinfo, "..");
01315                   Mread_int (pinfo, &end_subscript);
01316 
01317                   /* Do not allow negative subscripts */
01318                   if ((start_subscript < 0) || (end_subscript < 0))
01319                     {
01320                       Mparse_error (pinfo,
01321                                     "%s subscripts (%i..%i) must be >= 0",
01322                                     resource->name,
01323                                     start_subscript, end_subscript);
01324                     }
01325 
01326                   /* Determine if should increment or decrement
01327                    * from start to end subscript 
01328                    */
01329                   if (start_subscript <= end_subscript)
01330                     {
01331                       /* Add all subscripts to subscript list */
01332                       for (subscript = start_subscript;
01333                            subscript <= end_subscript; subscript++)
01334                         {
01335                           hmdes_add_res_subscript (pinfo, resource,
01336                                                    subscript, res_id);
01337                           res_id++;
01338                         }
01339                     }
01340                   else
01341                     {
01342                       /* Add all subscripts to subscript list */
01343                       for (subscript = start_subscript;
01344                            subscript >= end_subscript; subscript--)
01345                         {
01346                           hmdes_add_res_subscript (pinfo, resource,
01347                                                    subscript, res_id);
01348                           res_id++;
01349                         }
01350                     }
01351                 }
01352 
01353               /* Otherwise, just add subscript to list */
01354               else
01355                 {
01356                   /* Do not allow negative indexes */
01357                   if (start_subscript < 0)
01358                     {
01359                       Mparse_error (pinfo,
01360                                     "%s subscript (%i) must be >= 0",
01361                                     resource->name, start_subscript);
01362                     }
01363                   hmdes_add_res_subscript (pinfo, resource, start_subscript,
01364                                            res_id);
01365                   res_id++;
01366 
01367                 }
01368             }
01369 
01370           Mread_match (pinfo, "]");
01371         }
01372 
01373       /* If no subscripts are declared, default to subscript 0 */
01374       else
01375         {
01376           hmdes_add_res_subscript (pinfo, resource, 0, res_id);
01377           res_id++;
01378         }
01379 
01380       Minsert_unique_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->resources, resource->name,
01381                              resource);
01382 
01383       /* Do special processing slot resource */
01384       if (strcmp (resource->name, "slot") == 0)
01385         {
01386           /* Find max slot defined, needed by lmdes */
01387           hmdes->max_slot = -1;
01388           for (slot_sub = resource->head; slot_sub != NULL;
01389                slot_sub = slot_sub->next)
01390             {
01391               if (slot_sub->subscript > hmdes->max_slot)
01392                 hmdes->max_slot = slot_sub->subscript;
01393             }
01394 
01395           /* 
01396            * Slots must have all slots from 0 to max_slot defined,
01397            * This is the case if num_slots = max_slot + 1
01398            */
01399           if (resource->num_subscripts != (hmdes->max_slot + 1))
01400             {
01401 
01402               /* Find the missing slots */
01403               for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_slot; i++)
01404                 {
01405                   for (slot_sub = resource->head; slot_sub != NULL;
01406                        slot_sub = slot_sub->next)
01407                     {
01408                       if (slot_sub->subscript == i)
01409                         break;
01410                     }
01411                   if (slot_sub == NULL)
01412                     Mparse_fatal (pinfo, "Slot %i not declared.", i);
01413                 }
01414               Mparse_fatal (pinfo,
01415                             "All slots between 0 and max_slot(%i) "
01416                             "must be declared.", hmdes->max_slot);
01417             }
01418         }
01419     }
01420 
01421   /* Write how many resources there are to the hmdes structure */
01422   hmdes->num_resources = res_id;
01423 
01424   /* Make sure they defined at least one slot */
01425   if (Mfind_symbol (pinfo->hmdes->resources, "slot") == NULL)
01426     {
01427       Mparse_error (pinfo, "Must define at least one 'slot'.");
01428     }
01429   return;
01430 }
01431 
01432 /* 
01433  * Adds the resource 'name' to the option list for the res_node
01434  */
01435 void
01436 Madd_res_option (Mparse_Info * pinfo, Hmdes_Res_Node * node, char *name,
01437                  int subscript)
01438 {
01439   Hmdes_Res_Option *option;
01440   Hmdes_Res_Sub *sub;
01441   Msymbol_Table *table;
01442 
01443   Malloc_struct ((void **) (&option), sizeof (Hmdes_Res_Option));
01444 
01445   /* Get resouce this name corresponses to */
01446   table = pinfo->hmdes->resources;
01447   option->resource = (Hmdes_Resource *) Mfind_symbol (table, name);
01448   if (option->resource == NULL)
01449     Mparse_error (pinfo, "'%s' not found in %s symbol table", name,
01450                   table->name);
01451 
01452   /* Find subscript in resource subscript list */
01453   for (sub = option->resource->head; sub != NULL; sub = sub->next)
01454     {
01455       if (sub->subscript == subscript)
01456         break;
01457     }
01458 
01459   /* Detect if subscript is not defined */
01460   if (sub == NULL)
01461     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Subscript %i for '%s' has not been declared",
01462                   subscript, name);
01463 
01464   /* Point to appropriate subscript */
01465   option->subscript = sub;
01466 
01467   /* Add to end of linked list */
01468   option->next = NULL;
01469   if (node->tail == NULL)
01470     node->head = option;
01471   else
01472     node->tail->next = option;
01473   node->tail = option;
01474 
01475   node->num_options++;
01476 
01477   /* Is this a slot option */
01478   if (Mmatch ("slot", name))
01479     {
01480       /* Increment number of slot options */
01481       node->num_slots++;
01482     }
01483 }
01484 void
01485 hmdes_read_restables (Mparse_Info * pinfo)
01486 {
01487   Hmdes *hmdes;
01488   Hmdes_Res_List *list;
01489   Hmdes_Res_Node *node, *cur_node, *next_node;
01490   Hmdes_Res_Option *option, *cur_option, *next_option;
01491   Hmdes_Res_Sub *sub;
01492   Hmdes_Resource *slots_avail, *resource;
01493   Msymbol_Table *table;
01494   char list_name[MITEM_SIZE];
01495   char res_name[MITEM_SIZE];
01496   int list_id;
01497   int start_subscript;
01498   int end_subscript;
01499   int subscript;
01500 
01501   /* Get hmdes for easy use */
01502   hmdes = pinfo->hmdes;
01503 
01504   /* Initialize enumeration of resource lists */
01505   list_id = 0;
01506 
01507   /* Get a pointer to the slot resource for ease of use
01508    * when adding default slot options
01509    */
01510   slots_avail = (Hmdes_Resource *) Mfind_symbol (pinfo->hmdes->resources,
01511                                                  "slot");
01512   if (slots_avail == NULL)
01513     {
01514       H_punt ("No slots declared, should have been detected earlier");
01515     }
01516 
01517   while (!hmdes_section_end (pinfo))
01518     {
01519       /* Read list name and allocate list */
01520       Mread_name (pinfo, list_name, "ResTable");
01521       Malloc_struct ((void **) (&list), sizeof (Hmdes_Res_List));
01522       Malloc_name (&list->name, list_name);
01523       list->id = list_id;
01524       list->head = NULL;
01525       list->tail = NULL;
01526       list->slot_options = NULL;
01527       list->size = 0;
01528 
01529       Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
01530 
01531       /* While there are resource usage definitions of the
01532        * form: (issue 0) or (window 0..1)
01533        */
01534       while (Mis_next (pinfo, "("))
01535         {
01536           Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
01537 
01538           /* Alloc space for resource usage node */
01539           Malloc_struct ((void **) (&node), sizeof (Hmdes_Res_Node));
01540           node->head = NULL;
01541           node->tail = NULL;
01542           node->num_options = 0;
01543           node->num_slots = 0;
01544           node->flags = 0;
01545 
01546           /* Read in all the resources options */
01547           while (Mis_name_next (pinfo) || (node->num_options == 0))
01548             {
01549               /* Get resource name */
01550               Mread_name (pinfo, res_name, "Resource");
01551 
01552               /* Read in subscripts for resource if any */
01553               if (Mis_next (pinfo, "["))
01554                 {
01555                   Mread_match (pinfo, "[");
01556 
01557                   /* Make sure not empty [] */
01558                   if (Mis_next (pinfo, "]"))
01559                     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Empty [] not allowed");
01560 
01561                   /* Loop until ending ] to read in subscripts */
01562                   while (!Mis_next (pinfo, "]"))
01563                     {
01564                       /* Get lower bound on subscript */
01565                       Mread_int (pinfo, &start_subscript);
01566 
01567                       /* If followed by .., ready end_subscript */
01568                       if (Mis_next (pinfo, ".."))
01569                         {
01570                           Mread_match (pinfo, "..");
01571                           Mread_int (pinfo, &end_subscript);
01572 
01573                           /*
01574                            * Determine if should increment or decrement
01575                            * from start to end subscript
01576                            */
01577                           if (start_subscript <= end_subscript)
01578                             {
01579                               /* Add all subscripts to subscript list */
01580                               for (subscript = start_subscript;
01581                                    subscript <= end_subscript; subscript++)
01582                                 {
01583                                   Madd_res_option (pinfo, node, res_name,
01584                                                    subscript);
01585                                 }
01586                             }
01587                           else
01588                             {
01589                               /* Add all subscripts to subscript list */
01590                               for (subscript = start_subscript;
01591                                    subscript >= end_subscript; subscript--)
01592                                 {
01593                                   Madd_res_option (pinfo, node, res_name,
01594                                                    subscript);
01595                                 }
01596                             }
01597                         }
01598                       /* Otherwise, just add subscript to list */
01599                       else
01600                         {
01601                           Madd_res_option (pinfo, node, res_name,
01602                                            start_subscript);
01603                         }
01604                     }
01605 
01606                   Mread_match (pinfo, "]");
01607 
01608                 }
01609 
01610               /* If no subscripts are declared, default to all declared
01611                * subscripts for that resource (in declared order).
01612                */
01613               else
01614                 {
01615                   /* Get resouce this name corresponses to */
01616                   table = pinfo->hmdes->resources;
01617                   resource = (Hmdes_Resource *) Mfind_symbol (table,
01618                                                               res_name);
01619                   if (resource == NULL)
01620                     Mparse_error (pinfo,
01621                                   "'%s' not found in %s symbol table",
01622                                   res_name, table->name);
01623 
01624                   /* Add all subscripts in subscript list */
01625                   for (sub = resource->head; sub != NULL; sub = sub->next)
01626                     {
01627                       Madd_res_option (pinfo, node, res_name, sub->subscript);
01628                     }
01629 
01630                 }
01631             }
01632 
01633           /* Get start time */
01634           Mread_int (pinfo, &node->start_usage);
01635 
01636           /* Usage times may not be negative */
01637           if (node->start_usage < 0)
01638             Mparse_error (pinfo, "May not have negative usage times (%i)",
01639                           node->start_usage);
01640 
01641           /* If followed by ..number then that is the end
01642            * time otherwise, end time is start time
01643            */
01644           if (Mis_next (pinfo, ".."))
01645             {
01646               Mread_match (pinfo, "..");
01647               Mread_int (pinfo, &node->end_usage);
01648               /* May not be before start_usage */
01649               if (node->end_usage < node->start_usage)
01650                 Mparse_error (pinfo, "end_usage (%i) < start_usage (%i)",
01651                               node->end_usage, node->start_usage);
01652             }
01653           else
01654             {
01655               node->end_usage = node->start_usage;
01656             }
01657           Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
01658 
01659           /* Process slot options separately */
01660           if (node->num_slots > 0)
01661             {
01662               /* Slot may take up resources in cycle 0 only */
01663               if ((node->start_usage != 0) || (node->end_usage != 0))
01664                 {
01665                   Mparse_error (pinfo, "Slots may used only in cycle 0");
01666                 }
01667 
01668               /* 
01669                * If slot is declared in at least one option, it must be
01670                * declared in all options
01671                */
01672               if (node->num_options != node->num_slots)
01673                 {
01674                   Mparse_error (pinfo,
01675                                 "Either all options must have a slot "
01676                                 "declared or none may");
01677                 }
01678 
01679               /* 
01680                * There may only be one option list with slots in it.
01681                */
01682               if (list->slot_options != NULL)
01683                 {
01684                   Mparse_error (pinfo,
01685                                 "Only one slot may be used per resource list");
01686                 }
01687 
01688               /* Point to the slot options just declared */
01689               list->slot_options = node;
01690             }
01691 
01692           /* 
01693            * If minimizing res lists, then
01694            * Add non-slots to res_list in sorted order.
01695            * sort by three keys:
01696            * start_usage, end_usage, and num_options
01697            */
01698           else if (minimize_res_lists)
01699             {
01700               /* Currently unsorted, come back to it */
01701               node->next = NULL;
01702               if (list->tail == NULL)
01703                 list->head = node;
01704               else
01705                 list->tail->next = node;
01706               list->tail = node;
01707 
01708               /* Update res_list size */
01709               list->size++;
01710             }
01711 
01712           /*
01713            * Otherwise, if not mimimizing resouce lists,
01714            * add to end of resource list      
01715            */
01716           else
01717             {
01718               node->next = NULL;
01719               if (list->tail == NULL)
01720                 list->head = node;
01721               else
01722                 list->tail->next = node;
01723               list->tail = node;
01724 
01725               /* Update res_list size */
01726               list->size++;
01727             }
01728 
01729           /* Mark resource node if it might allocate the same resource
01730            * at the same time as a prevois resource node in this 
01731            * resource list.  Special RU_manager processing is needed then.
01732            * This marking speeds up the RU_manager since that special
01733            * processing is slow and pointless if that condition is not met.
01734            * -JCG 1/12/95p 
01735            */
01736           /* Scan all res nodes before the current node, list->head may
01737            * be NULL (for NOPs)
01738            */
01739           cur_node = node;
01740           for (node = list->head; (node != cur_node) && (node != NULL);
01741                node = next_node)
01742             {
01743               /* Get next node so can set to NULL if match found */
01744               next_node = node->next;
01745 
01746               /* If nodes do not overlap in time, there cannot be a problem */
01747               if ((node->end_usage < cur_node->start_usage) ||
01748                   (node->start_usage > cur_node->end_usage))
01749                 continue;
01750 
01751               /* Nodes overlap in time, if they have an option in common
01752                * that use the same resource, mark that they need special
01753                * processing (overlap).
01754                */
01755               for (option = node->head; option != NULL; option = next_option)
01756                 {
01757                   /* Get next option so can set to NULL if match found */
01758                   next_option = option->next;
01759 
01760                   for (cur_option = cur_node->head; cur_option != NULL;
01761                        cur_option = cur_option->next)
01762                     {
01763                       if (cur_option->subscript->id == option->subscript->id)
01764                         {
01765                           /* Can overlap previous node.  Mark and stop
01766                            * search by setting next_node and next_option
01767                            * to termination conditions.
01768                            */
01769                           cur_node->flags |= MDES_OVERLAPPING_REQUEST;
01770                           next_node = NULL;
01771                           next_option = NULL;
01772                           break;
01773                         }
01774                     }
01775                 }
01776             }
01777 
01778         }
01779 
01780       Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
01781 
01782       /* Punt no slots were declared */
01783       if ((list->slot_options == NULL))
01784         {
01785           Mparse_error (pinfo,
01786                         "A slot resource must be used by %s.", list->name);
01787         }
01788 
01789       Minsert_unique_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->res_lists, list->name, list);
01790       list_id++;
01791     }
01792   return;
01793 }
01794 
01795 /*
01796  * Read latency info.  Treats - as 0, and fills latency table
01797  * with 0's if at ')'.  Otherwise, reads latency from file.
01798  *
01799  * I had things default to -1 before, but it was too hard
01800  * to check to see if a latency was invalid.
01801  */
01802 void
01803 Mread_latency (Mparse_Info * pinfo, int *ptr)
01804 {
01805   /* If a dash, read as -1 */
01806   if (Mis_next (pinfo, "-"))
01807     {
01808       Mread_match (pinfo, "-");
01809       *ptr = 0;
01810       return;
01811     }
01812 
01813   /* If a ')', implicitly this read is a 0, does not consume ')' */
01814   if (Mis_next (pinfo, ")"))
01815     {
01816       *ptr = 0;
01817       return;
01818     }
01819 
01820   if (Mread_int (pinfo, ptr))
01821     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Unexpected EOF");
01822 }
01823 
01824 void
01825 hmdes_read_latencies (Mparse_Info * pinfo)
01826 {
01827   Hmdes *hmdes;
01828   Hmdes_Latency *lat;
01829   char lat_name[MITEM_SIZE];
01830   int array_size, i;
01831   int lat_id;
01832 
01833   /* Get hmdes for easy use */
01834   hmdes = pinfo->hmdes;
01835 
01836   /* Intialize enumeration of latencies */
01837   lat_id = 0;
01838 
01839   while (!hmdes_section_end (pinfo))
01840     {
01841       /* Read latency name and allocate struct */
01842       Mread_name (pinfo, lat_name, "Latency");
01843       Malloc_struct ((void **) (&lat), sizeof (Hmdes_Latency));
01844       Malloc_name (&lat->name, lat_name);
01845       lat->id = lat_id;
01846 
01847       /* Allocate block of ints and break up among src, src_sync, etc */
01848       array_size = sizeof (int) * (hmdes->max_src_syncs +
01849                                    hmdes->max_src_operands +
01850                                    hmdes->max_dest_syncs +
01851                                    hmdes->max_dest_operands +
01852                                    hmdes->max_pred_operands);
01853       Malloc_struct ((void **) (&lat->sync_src), array_size);
01854       lat->src = &lat->sync_src[hmdes->max_src_syncs];
01855       lat->sync_dest = &lat->src[hmdes->max_src_operands];
01856       lat->dest = &lat->sync_dest[hmdes->max_dest_syncs];
01857       lat->pred = &lat->dest[hmdes->max_dest_operands];
01858 
01859       /* Read ' ( exception' */
01860       Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
01861       Mread_int (pinfo, &lat->exception);
01862 
01863       /* Read  (pred[0] ...) */
01864       Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
01865       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_pred_operands; i++)
01866         Mread_latency (pinfo, &lat->pred[i]);
01867       Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
01868 
01869       /* Read (dest[0] ...) */
01870       Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
01871       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_dest_operands; i++)
01872         Mread_latency (pinfo, &lat->dest[i]);
01873       Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
01874 
01875       /* Read (src[0] ...) */
01876       Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
01877       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_src_operands; i++)
01878         Mread_latency (pinfo, &lat->src[i]);
01879       Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
01880 
01881       /* Read  (sync_dest[0] ...) */
01882       Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
01883       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_dest_syncs; i++)
01884         Mread_latency (pinfo, &lat->sync_dest[i]);
01885       Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
01886 
01887       /* Read  (sync_src[0] ...) */
01888       Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
01889       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_src_syncs; i++)
01890         Mread_latency (pinfo, &lat->sync_src[i]);
01891       Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
01892 
01893       Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
01894 
01895       Minsert_unique_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->latencies, lat->name, lat);
01896       lat_id++;
01897     }
01898   return;
01899 }
01900 
01901 /* Reads and builds a class of name 'class_name' and inserts
01902  * it into the class symbol table.  Returns a pointer to
01903  * the class just built.
01904  * 
01905  * Used for implicite class definitions when reading 
01906  * operations, and becuase it is here, used for reading operation 
01907  * classes.
01908  */
01909 Hmdes_Operation_Class *
01910 hmdes_read_class_def (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *class_name)
01911 {
01912   Hmdes *hmdes;
01913   Hmdes_Operation_Class *class;
01914   Hmdes_Class_Node *node;
01915 
01916   /* Get hmdes for easy use */
01917   hmdes = pinfo->hmdes;
01918 
01919   Malloc_struct ((void **) (&class), sizeof (Hmdes_Operation_Class));
01920   Malloc_name (&class->name, class_name);
01921   class->head = NULL;
01922   class->tail = NULL;
01923   class->size = 0;
01924 
01925   Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
01926 
01927   /*
01928    * While there are class node definitions of the form:
01929    * (io_list, resource_list, latency)
01930    */
01931   while (Mis_next (pinfo, "("))
01932     {
01933       Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
01934 
01935       /* Allocate space for class node */
01936       Malloc_struct ((void **) (&node), sizeof (Hmdes_Class_Node));
01937 
01938       Mread_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->IO_items, (void **) (&node->io_item),
01939                     "IO item");
01940       Mread_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->res_lists, (void **) (&node->res_list),
01941                     "ResTable");
01942       Mread_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->latencies, (void **) (&node->latency),
01943                     "Latency");
01944 
01945       Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
01946 
01947       /* Add to class list */
01948       node->next = NULL;
01949       if (class->tail == NULL)
01950         class->head = node;
01951       else
01952         class->tail->next = node;
01953       class->tail = node;
01954 
01955       /* Update res_list size */
01956       class->size++;
01957 
01958     }
01959   Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
01960   Minsert_unique_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->op_class, class->name, class);
01961 
01962   return (class);
01963 }
01964 
01965 void
01966 hmdes_read_operation_class (Mparse_Info * pinfo)
01967 {
01968   Hmdes *hmdes;
01969   char class_name[MITEM_SIZE];
01970 
01971   /* Get hmdes for easy use */
01972   hmdes = pinfo->hmdes;
01973 
01974   while (!hmdes_section_end (pinfo))
01975     {
01976       /* Read class name and allocate struct */
01977       Mread_name (pinfo, class_name, "Class");
01978       hmdes_read_class_def (pinfo, class_name);
01979     }
01980   return;
01981 }
01982 
01983 void
01984 Mfree_flag_list (Hmdes_Flag_List * flag_list)
01985 {
01986   Hmdes_Flag *flag, *next_flag;
01987 
01988   for (flag = flag_list->head; flag != NULL; flag = next_flag)
01989     {
01990       next_flag = flag->next;
01991 
01992       free (flag->name);
01993       free (flag);
01994     }
01995 
01996   flag_list->head = NULL;
01997   flag_list->num_flags = 0;
01998   flag_list->bit_version = 0;
01999 }
02000 
02001 /*
02002  * Returns 1 if flags lists are identical, 0 otherwise
02003  */
02004 int
02005 Mmatch_flag_lists (Hmdes_Flag_List * list1, Hmdes_Flag_List * list2)
02006 {
02007   Hmdes_Flag *flag1, *flag2;
02008 
02009   /* Make sure lists are the same length */
02010   if (list1->num_flags != list2->num_flags)
02011     return (0);
02012 
02013   /* Compare alphabetical list to make sure they are the same */
02014   flag1 = list1->head;
02015   flag2 = list2->head;
02016   for (flag1 = list1->head, flag2 = list2->head;
02017        ((flag1 != NULL) && (flag2 != NULL));
02018        flag1 = flag1->next, flag2 = flag2->next)
02019     {
02020       /* If names don't match, return 0 */
02021       if (strcmp (flag1->name, flag2->name) != 0)
02022         return (0);
02023     }
02024 
02025   /* If got this far, list must be the same */
02026   return (1);
02027 }
02028 
02029 /* A flag bit mask must have exactly one bit set.
02030  * Returns 1 if a valid flag value.
02031  * Otherwise warns and returns 0.
02032  */
02033 int
02034 valid_flag_value (Mparse_Info * pinfo, Hmdes_Flag * flag)
02035 {
02036   int i;
02037   unsigned int value;
02038 
02039   /* Test for no bits set */
02040   if (flag->value == 0)
02041     {
02042       Mparse_fatal (pinfo,
02043                     "Flag %s: Invalid value 0x%08x.  "
02044                     "Exactly 1 bit must be set.", flag->name, flag->value);
02045       return (0);
02046     }
02047 
02048   /* Get value into unsigned int for testing using shifts */
02049   value = flag->value;
02050 
02051   /* Test for more than one bit set */
02052   for (i = 0; i < 32; i++)
02053     {
02054       /* Right shift until the rightmost bit is one */
02055       if (((value >> i) & 1) == 1)
02056         {
02057           /* If only one bit set, after shift should be exactly 1 */
02058           if ((value >> i) == 1)
02059             {
02060               /* Valid mask, exactly one bit set */
02061               return (1);
02062             }
02063           else
02064             {
02065               Mparse_fatal (pinfo,
02066                             "Flag %s: Invalid value 0x%08x.  "
02067                             "Exactly 1 bit must be set.",
02068                             flag->name, flag->value);
02069               return (0);
02070             }
02071         }
02072     }
02073 
02074   H_punt ("valid_flag_value: Should never have gotten here");
02075   return (0);
02076 }
02077 
02078 /* Reads in flag, adds to flag_list in alphabetical order, 
02079  * and prints warning if flag not defined (with flag_prefix) in
02080  * header file.
02081  */
02082 void
02083 Mread_flag (Mparse_Info * pinfo, Hmdes_Flag_List * flag_list,
02084             char *flag_prefix, char *desc)
02085 {
02086   Hmdes_Flag *flag, *ptr, *insert_after;
02087   char flag_name[MITEM_SIZE];
02088   char header_name[MITEM_SIZE + 50];
02089   int comp_val, ret_val;
02090 
02091   /* Get flag name */
02092   Mread_name (pinfo, flag_name, desc);
02093 
02094   /* Allocate flag structure */
02095   Malloc_struct ((void **) &flag, sizeof (Hmdes_Flag));
02096   Malloc_name (&flag->name, flag_name);
02097 
02098   /* Add to flag list in alphabetical order */
02099   insert_after = NULL;
02100   for (ptr = flag_list->head; ptr != NULL; ptr = ptr->next)
02101     {
02102       comp_val = strcmp (flag_name, ptr->name);
02103 
02104       /* Punt if flag already in list */
02105       if (comp_val == 0)
02106         Mparse_error (pinfo, "Flag '%s' specified twice", flag_name);
02107 
02108       /* If should go before this one, exit loop */
02109       if (comp_val < 0)
02110         break;
02111 
02112       /* We know we need to insert after this flag */
02113       insert_after = ptr;
02114     }
02115 
02116   /* Insert flag after insert_after, if NULL, put at begining of list */
02117   if (insert_after == NULL)
02118     {
02119       flag->next = flag_list->head;
02120       flag_list->head = flag;
02121     }
02122 
02123   /* Otherwise, insert after insert_after */
02124   else
02125     {
02126       flag->next = insert_after->next;
02127       insert_after->next = flag;
02128     }
02129 
02130   flag_list->num_flags++;
02131 
02132   /* Warn if flag name (with prefix) is not found in header files */
02133   sprintf (header_name, "%s%s", flag_prefix, flag_name);
02134 
02135   /* Get value from header file for this flag */
02136   if ((ret_val = find_header_value (pinfo, header_name, &flag->value)) != 1)
02137     {
02138       if (ret_val == 0)
02139         {
02140           Mparse_fatal (pinfo,
02141                         "Flag %s (%s) not defined in header files.",
02142                         flag_name, header_name);
02143         }
02144     }
02145 
02146   /* Set bit mask for flag if flag has valid value */
02147   else if (valid_flag_value (pinfo, flag))
02148     {
02149 
02150       /* Make flag bit is not already set */
02151       if ((flag_list->bit_version & flag->value) != 0)
02152         {
02153           /* Find flags that has the same value as it */
02154           for (ptr = flag_list->head; ptr != flag; ptr = ptr->next)
02155             {
02156               if (ptr->value == flag->value)
02157                 {
02158                   Mparse_fatal (pinfo,
02159                                 "Flags %s and %s defined "
02160                                 "to same value 0x%08x.",
02161                                 ptr->name, flag->name, flag->value);
02162                   break;
02163                 }
02164             }
02165         }
02166       else
02167         {
02168           flag_list->bit_version |= flag->value;
02169         }
02170     }
02171 }
02172 
02173 void
02174 hmdes_read_operations (Mparse_Info * pinfo)
02175 {
02176   Hmdes *hmdes;
02177   Hmdes_Operation *op;
02178   Hmdes_Operation_Node *node;
02179   char class_name[MITEM_SIZE];
02180   char op_name[MITEM_SIZE];
02181   char asm_name[MITEM_SIZE];
02182   int first_def;
02183   int iclass_no;
02184   Hmdes_Flag_List flag_list;
02185   int ret_val;
02186 
02187   /* Initialize count of number of implicit classes */
02188   iclass_no = 0;
02189 
02190   /* Get hmdes for easy use */
02191   hmdes = pinfo->hmdes;
02192 
02193   /* Initialize flag list */
02194   flag_list.head = NULL;
02195   flag_list.num_flags = 0;
02196   flag_list.bit_version = 0;
02197 
02198   while (!hmdes_section_end (pinfo))
02199     {
02200       /* Read op name and allocate if doesn't already exist */
02201       Mread_name (pinfo, op_name, "Operation");
02202       op = (Hmdes_Operation *) Mfind_symbol (hmdes->operations, op_name);
02203       if (op == NULL)
02204         {
02205           Malloc_struct ((void **) (&op), sizeof (Hmdes_Operation));
02206           Malloc_name (&op->name, op_name);
02207           op->head = NULL;
02208           op->tail = NULL;
02209           op->size = 0;
02210           op->op_flags.head = NULL;
02211           op->op_flags.num_flags = 0;
02212           op->op_flags.bit_version = 0;
02213           first_def = 1;
02214 
02215           /* Get it's external id */
02216           if ((ret_val = find_header_value (pinfo, op->name, &op->id)) != 1)
02217             {
02218               if (ret_val == 0)
02219                 {
02220                   Mparse_fatal (pinfo,
02221                                 "%s not found in C header files.", op->name);
02222                 }
02223             }
02224         }
02225       else
02226         first_def = 0;
02227 
02228       /* Free any existing flags in flag list */
02229       Mfree_flag_list (&flag_list);
02230 
02231       /* Read in op flags (if any) into temp flags list */
02232       if (Mis_next (pinfo, "<"))
02233         {
02234           Mread_match (pinfo, "<");
02235           while (!Mis_next (pinfo, ">"))
02236             {
02237               Mread_flag (pinfo, &flag_list, "OP_FLAG_", "Operation flag");
02238             }
02239           Mread_match (pinfo, ">");
02240         }
02241 
02242       /* If not the first definition of the operation,
02243        * make sure have the same flags defined.
02244        */
02245       if (!first_def)
02246         {
02247           if (!Mmatch_flag_lists (&flag_list, &op->op_flags))
02248             {
02249               Mparse_fatal (pinfo,
02250                             "%s flags differ from previous definition.",
02251                             op->name);
02252             }
02253 
02254           /* Free flag list, don't need to duplicate it */
02255           Mfree_flag_list (&flag_list);
02256         }
02257 
02258       /* If first def, transfer list over to op flags */
02259       else
02260         {
02261           op->op_flags.head = flag_list.head;
02262           op->op_flags.num_flags = flag_list.num_flags;
02263           op->op_flags.bit_version = flag_list.bit_version;
02264           flag_list.head = NULL;
02265           flag_list.num_flags = 0;
02266           flag_list.bit_version = 0;
02267         }
02268 
02269       /*
02270        * Read op node of form : (asm_name  <flags> class)
02271        * If there are no flags, <> is not needed.
02272        */
02273       Mread_match (pinfo, "(");
02274 
02275       /* Read asm name and allocate node for this op */
02276       Mread_name (pinfo, asm_name, "Asm");
02277       Malloc_struct ((void **) (&node), sizeof (Hmdes_Operation_Node));
02278       Malloc_name (&node->asm_name, asm_name);
02279       node->mdes_flags.head = NULL;
02280       node->mdes_flags.num_flags = 0;
02281       node->mdes_flags.bit_version = 0;
02282 
02283       /* Read in mdes flags (if any) into op node n */
02284       if (Mis_next (pinfo, "<"))
02285         {
02286           Mread_match (pinfo, "<");
02287           while (!Mis_next (pinfo, ">"))
02288             {
02289               Mread_flag (pinfo, &node->mdes_flags, "ALT_FLAG_", "Alt flag");
02290             }
02291           Mread_match (pinfo, ">");
02292         }
02293 
02294       /* Read implicit or explicit classes */
02295       if (Mis_next (pinfo, "("))
02296         {
02297           iclass_no++;
02298           sprintf (class_name, "__implicit_class_%i", iclass_no);
02299           node->class = hmdes_read_class_def (pinfo, class_name);
02300         }
02301       else
02302         {
02303           /* Read class name and get pointer to it */
02304           Mread_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->op_class, (void **) (&node->class),
02305                         "Class");
02306         }
02307 
02308       Mread_match (pinfo, ")");
02309 
02310 
02311       /* Add to op's list of alternatives */
02312       node->next = NULL;
02313       if (op->tail == NULL)
02314         op->head = node;
02315       else
02316         op->tail->next = node;
02317       op->tail = node;
02318 
02319       /* Update res_list size */
02320       op->size++;
02321 
02322       /* If this is the first defition of this op, add to symbol table */
02323       if (first_def)
02324         Minsert_unique_symbol (pinfo, hmdes->operations, op->name, op);
02325     }
02326 
02327   return;
02328 }
02329 
02330 /*
02331  * Print out all info on the operation name passed.
02332  */
02333 void
02334 Mprint_op (FILE * out, Hmdes * hmdes, char *name)
02335 {
02336   Hmdes_Operation *op;
02337   Hmdes_Operation_Node *op_node;
02338   Hmdes_Class_Node *c_node;
02339   Hmdes_IO_Item *item;
02340   Hmdes_Res_Node *r_node;
02341   Hmdes_Res_Option *option;
02342   Hmdes_Latency *lat;
02343   Hmdes_Flag *flag;
02344   int op_num, c_num;
02345   int i;
02346 
02347   fprintf (out, "\n%s instruction structure:\n", hmdes->file_name);
