02348   fprintf (out, "%i pred operands\n", hmdes->max_pred_operands);
02349   fprintf (out, "%i dest operands\n", hmdes->max_src_operands);
02350   fprintf (out, "%i dest syncs\n", hmdes->max_dest_syncs);
02351   fprintf (out, "%i source operands\n", hmdes->max_src_operands);
02352   fprintf (out, "%i source syncs\n", hmdes->max_src_syncs);
02353   fprintf (out, "\n");
02354 
02355   op = Mfind_symbol (hmdes->operations, name);
02356 
02357   if (op == NULL)
02358     H_punt ("'%s' is not defined in hmdes file", name);
02359 
02360   if (op->id == -1)
02361     fprintf (out, "%s (opcode unknown)", op->name);
02362   else
02363     fprintf (out, "%s (%i) ", op->name, op->id);
02364 
02365   if (op->op_flags.num_flags != 0)
02366     fprintf (out, "<");
02367   for (flag = op->op_flags.head; flag != NULL; flag = flag->next)
02368     {
02369       fprintf (out, "%s", flag->name);
02370       if (flag->next != NULL)
02371         fprintf (out, ", ");
02372     }
02373   if (op->op_flags.num_flags != 0)
02374     fprintf (out, ">");
02375 
02376   if (op->size == 1)
02377     fprintf (out, " (%i asm name option):\n\n", op->size);
02378   else
02379     fprintf (out, " (%i asm name options):\n\n", op->size);
02380 
02381   op_num = 0;
02382   for (op_node = op->head; op_node != NULL; op_node = op_node->next)
02383     {
02384       op_num++;
02385       fprintf (out, "  asm name %i: '%s' ", op_num, op_node->asm_name);
02386 
02387       if (op_node->mdes_flags.num_flags != 0)
02388         fprintf (out, "<");
02389       for (flag = op_node->mdes_flags.head; flag != NULL; flag = flag->next)
02390         {
02391           fprintf (out, "%s", flag->name);
02392           if (flag->next != NULL)
02393             fprintf (out, ", ");
02394         }
02395       if (op_node->mdes_flags.num_flags != 0)
02396         fprintf (out, ">");
02397 
02398       fprintf (out, " %s", op_node->class->name);
02399       fprintf (out, "\n");
02400 
02401       c_num = 0;
02402 
02403       for (c_node = op_node->class->head; c_node != NULL;
02404            c_node = c_node->next)
02405         {
02406           c_num++;
02407           fprintf (out, "    resource option %i:\n", c_num);
02408 
02409           item = c_node->io_item;
02410           lat = c_node->latency;
02411           /* Print out io item */
02412           fprintf (out, "      %-11s (", item->name);
02413 
02414           if (hmdes->max_pred_operands > 0)
02415             fprintf (out, "<");
02416 
02417           /* Print predicates */
02418           for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_pred_operands; i++)
02419             {
02420               if (item->pred[i] == NULL)
02421                 fprintf (out, " -   ");
02422               else
02423                 fprintf (out, "%-5s ", item->pred[i]->name);
02424             }
02425           if (hmdes->max_pred_operands > 0)
02426             fprintf (out, "> ");
02427 
02428           fprintf (out, "[");
02429           for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_dest_operands; i++)
02430             {
02431               if (item->dest[i] == NULL)
02432                 fprintf (out, " -   ");
02433               else
02434                 fprintf (out, "%-5s ", item->dest[i]->name);
02435             }
02436           fprintf (out, "] [");
02437 
02438           for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_src_operands; i++)
02439             {
02440               if (item->src[i] == NULL)
02441                 fprintf (out, " -   ");
02442               else
02443                 fprintf (out, "%-5s ", item->src[i]->name);
02444             }
02445           fprintf (out, "])\n");
02446 
02447           fprintf (out, "      %s:\n", c_node->res_list->name);
02448           fprintf (out, "        slots: ");
02449           for (option = c_node->res_list->slot_options->head;
02450                option != NULL; option = option->next)
02451             {
02452               fprintf (out, "%i ", option->subscript->subscript);
02453             }
02454           fprintf (out, "\n");
02455 
02456           for (r_node = c_node->res_list->head; r_node != NULL;
02457                r_node = r_node->next)
02458             {
02459               fprintf (out, "        (");
02460 
02461               for (option = r_node->head; option != NULL;
02462                    option = option->next)
02463                 {
02464                   fprintf (out, "%s[%i]", option->resource->name,
02465                            option->subscript->subscript);
02466 
02467                   if (option->next != NULL)
02468                     fprintf (out, ",\n         ");
02469 
02470                 }
02471               fprintf (out, " %i", r_node->start_usage);
02472               if (r_node->start_usage != r_node->end_usage)
02473                 fprintf (out, "..%i", r_node->end_usage);
02474               fprintf (out, ")\n");
02475             }
02476 
02477           fprintf (out, "      %-11s ( %2i (", lat->name, lat->exception);
02478           for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_src_syncs; i++)
02479             {
02480               if (lat->sync_src[i] == -1)
02481                 fprintf (out, " - ");
02482               else
02483                 fprintf (out, "%2i ", lat->sync_src[i]);
02484             }
02485           fprintf (out, ")  (");
02486           for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_src_operands; i++)
02487             {
02488               if (lat->src[i] == -1)
02489                 fprintf (out, " - ");
02490               else
02491                 fprintf (out, "%2i ", lat->src[i]);
02492             }
02493           fprintf (out, ")  (");
02494           for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_dest_syncs; i++)
02495             {
02496               if (lat->sync_dest[i] == -1)
02497                 fprintf (out, " - ");
02498               else
02499                 fprintf (out, "%2i ", lat->sync_dest[i]);
02500             }
02501           fprintf (out, ")  (");
02502           for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_dest_operands; i++)
02503             {
02504               if (lat->dest[i] == -1)
02505                 fprintf (out, " - ");
02506               else
02507                 fprintf (out, "%2i ", lat->dest[i]);
02508             }
02509           fprintf (out, ")  (");
02510           for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_pred_operands; i++)
02511             {
02512               if (lat->pred[i] == -1)
02513                 fprintf (out, " - ");
02514               else
02515                 fprintf (out, "%2i ", lat->pred[i]);
02516             }
02517           fprintf (out, "))\n");
02518           fprintf (out, "\n");
02519         }
02520 
02521 
02522       fprintf (out, "\n");
02523 
02524     }
02525 }
02526 
02527 /*
02528  * If the next items in the file being parse are 'end' and ')', 
02529  *    they are read from the file and 1 is returned.
02530  * 
02531  * Otherwise, nothing is read from the file and 0 is returned.
02532  */
02533 int
02534 hmdes_section_end (Mparse_Info * pinfo)
02535 {
02536   char buf1[MITEM_SIZE];
02537   char buf2[MITEM_SIZE];
02538 
02539   /* Peek to see what the next two items in the file are */
02540   if ((Mpeek_ahead (pinfo, 0, buf1) == EOF) ||
02541       (Mpeek_ahead (pinfo, 1, buf2) == EOF))
02542     Mparse_error (pinfo, "Unexpected EOF, expecting 'end )'");
02543 
02544   /* if they are 'end' and ')', read them from file and return 1 */
02545   if (Mmatch ("end", buf1) && Mmatch (")", buf2))
02546     {
02547       /* Make sure Mget_next is behaiving properly */
02548       if ((Mget_next (pinfo, buf1) == EOF) ||
02549           (Mget_next (pinfo, buf2) == EOF))
02550         Mparse_error (pinfo, "hmdes_section_end: algorithm error caused EOF");
02551 
02552       return (1);
02553     }
02554 
02555   /* Otherwise, return 0 to signal not at end of section */
02556   return (0);
02557 }
02558 
02559 /*
02560  * Peeks ahead in the file, returns the i'th item the
02561  * current place in the file.  This does not effect
02562  * what will be next returned by Mget_next().
02563  *
02564  * A distance of 0 returns the next item in the file.
02565  */
02566 int
02567 Mpeek_ahead (Mparse_Info * pinfo, int dist, char *buf)
02568 {
02569   Mparse_Item *item;
02570   int i;
02571 
02572   /* Sanity check */
02573   if (dist < 0)
02574     H_punt ("Mpeek_ahead: dist (%i) must be >= 0", dist);
02575 
02576   /* Parse lines until have item we what to peek at */
02577   while (pinfo->queue_size <= dist)
02578     {
02579       /* If reach EOF file before reach item, return EOF
02580        * Also copy (EOF) into buffer for debugging purposes
02581        */
02582       if (Mparse_next_line (pinfo) == EOF)
02583         {
02584           strcpy (buf, "(EOF)");
02585           return (EOF);
02586         }
02587     }
02588 
02589   /* Find the desired item in the linked list */
02590   item = pinfo->head;
02591   for (i = 0; i < dist; i++)
02592     item = item->next;
02593 
02594   /* Copy item to the return buffer */
02595   strcpy (buf, item->buf);
02596 
02597   return (0);
02598 }
02599 
02600 /*
02601  * Gets the next item from file and copies it to buf.
02602  *
02603  * Returns 0 or EOF.
02604  */
02605 int
02606 Mget_next (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *buf)
02607 {
02608   Mparse_Item *item;
02609 
02610   /* If nothing currently parsed, parse the next line */
02611   if (pinfo->head == NULL)
02612     {
02613       /* If hit EOF, copy (EOF) into buf and return EOF */
02614       if (Mparse_next_line (pinfo) == EOF)
02615         {
02616           strcpy (buf, "(EOF)");
02617           return (EOF);
02618         }
02619     }
02620 
02621   /* 
02622    * Copy the item to the passed buf and return 0
02623    */
02624   /* Pull top item off list */
02625   item = pinfo->head;
02626   pinfo->head = item->next;
02627   if (pinfo->head == NULL)
02628     pinfo->tail = NULL;
02629   pinfo->queue_size--;
02630 
02631   /* Copy contents to passed buffer */
02632   strcpy (buf, item->buf);
02633 
02634   /* Return item to free list */
02635   L_free (Mparse_Item_pool, item);
02636 
02637   return (0);
02638 
02639 }
02640 
02641 void
02642 L_preprocess_line (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *raw_line, char *buf, int max)
02643 {
02644   int i, j, value_size;
02645   char *line;
02646   char name_buf[MLINE_SIZE], *value, *name, *end_ptr;
02647   int define_declaration;
02648   Hmdes *hmdes;
02649 
02650   /* Decrement max, so have room for terminator */
02651   max--;
02652 
02653   /* Strip away leading and trailing whitespace and comments */
02654   line = Mstrip (raw_line);
02655 
02656 
02657   /* Detect $define at beginning line (after we strip whitespace) */
02658   if ((line[0] == '$') && (line[1] == 'd') && (line[2] == 'e') &&
02659       (line[3] == 'f') && (line[4] == 'i') && (line[5] == 'n') &&
02660       (line[6] == 'e') && (isspace (line[7])))
02661     define_declaration = 1;
02662   else
02663     define_declaration = 0;
02664 
02665   /* Do not preprocess the $define at the beginning of lines */
02666   if (define_declaration)
02667     {
02668       strcpy (buf, "$define");
02669       i = 7;
02670       line += 7;
02671     }
02672   else
02673     {
02674       i = 0;
02675     }
02676 
02677   while (*line != 0)
02678     {
02679       /* Make sure we dont exceed buffer size */
02680       if (i >= max)
02681         Mparse_error (pinfo,
02682                       "Line too long after preprocessing (max len %i)",
02683                       max + 1);
02684 
02685       /* If not a defined_name start symbol $, just copy to buf */
02686       if (*line != '$')
02687         {
02688           buf[i] = *line;
02689           i++;
02690         }
02691 
02692       /* Otherwise, replace $defined_name$ with it's value */
02693       else
02694         {
02695           line++;
02696           j = 0;
02697 
02698           /* Get the defined_name */
02699           while ((*line != 0) && (*line != '$'))
02700             {
02701               /* Make sure there isn't any white space in name */
02702               if (isspace (*line))
02703                 {
02704                   name_buf[j] = 0;
02705                   Mparse_error (pinfo,
02706                                 "Expecting $ after (no whitespace) '$%s'",
02707                                 name_buf);
02708                 }
02709               /* Copy over character */
02710               name_buf[j] = *line;
02711               j++;
02712               line++;
02713 
02714               /* Make sure we dont exceeded name buf size */
02715               if (j >= sizeof (name_buf))
02716                 {
02717                   name_buf[sizeof (name_buf) - 1] = 0;
02718                   Mparse_error (pinfo, "Name too long '$%s...'", name_buf);
02719                 }
02720 
02721             }
02722           name_buf[j] = 0;
02723 
02724           /* Verify had ending $ */
02725           if (*line != '$')
02726             {
02727               if (strcmp (name_buf, "define") == 0)
02728                 Mparse_error (pinfo, "Expecting a name after '$define'");
02729               else
02730                 Mparse_error (pinfo,
02731                               "Missing or misplaced ending $ for '$%s'",
02732                               name_buf);
02733             }
02734 
02735           /*
02736            * Get defined value for name,
02737            * Search tables in this order: command_line, environment, internal
02738            */
02739           hmdes = pinfo->hmdes;
02740           if (((value = Mfind_symbol (hmdes->defines_command,
02741                                       name_buf)) == NULL) &&
02742               ((value = Mfind_symbol (hmdes->defines_environ,
02743                                       name_buf)) == NULL) &&
02744               ((value = Mfind_symbol (hmdes->defines_internal,
02745                                       name_buf)) == NULL))
02746             Mparse_error (pinfo,
02747                           "'$%s$' undefined.  Use '$define %s value'",
02748                           name_buf, name_buf);
02749 
02750           /* Get length of value */
02751           value_size = strlen (value);
02752 
02753           /* Make sure copying in value won't exceed buffer size */
02754           if ((i + value_size) > max)
02755             Mparse_error (pinfo,
02756                           "Line too long after preprocessing (max %i).",
02757                           max + 1);
02758 
02759           /* Copy macro to buf */
02760           strcpy (&buf[i], value);
02761 
02762           /* Update size of buffer */
02763           i += value_size;
02764         }
02765 
02766       line++;
02767     }
02768   /* Terminate buffer */
02769   buf[i] = 0;
02770 
02771   /* Strip away any comments and trailing whitespace added by macro defs */
02772   if (Mstrip (buf) != &buf[0])
02773     H_punt ("L_preprocess_line: Internal error. Unexpected Mstrip value");
02774   /* Process define declartions now */
02775   if (define_declaration)
02776     {
02777       /* Find beginning of defined name */
02778       name = &buf[8];
02779       while (isspace (*name))
02780         name++;
02781 
02782       /* Find end of defined name */
02783       end_ptr = name;
02784       while ((*end_ptr != 0) && (!isspace (*end_ptr)))
02785         end_ptr++;
02786 
02787       /* Find beginning of value */
02788       value = end_ptr;
02789       while (isspace (*value))
02790         value++;
02791 
02792       /* Terminate name */
02793       *end_ptr = 0;
02794 
02795       /* Insert name into internal table */
02796       Minsert_symbol (pinfo->hmdes->defines_internal, name, strdup (value));
02797 
02798       /* Make line empty after preprocessing */
02799       buf[0] = 0;
02800     }
02801 }
02802 
02803 /*
02804  * Parses the next non-blank/comment line into many items placing
02805  * them all on a linked list in pinfo.
02806  * A item consists of a var_name, a number or a punctuation character.
02807  *
02808  * Returns EOF at end of file or 0 if ok.
02809  *
02810  * Max line size allowed is (MLINE_SIZE -1) and the max item size 
02811  * is (MITEM_SIZE -1). (One character is needed for terminator)
02812  * This routine will punt if the above sizes are violated. 
02813  */
02814 
02815 static int
02816 Mparse_next_line (Mparse_Info * pinfo)
02817 {
02818   char in_buf[MLINE_SIZE + 1], raw_in_buf[MLINE_SIZE + 1];
02819   char *ptr;
02820   Mparse_Item *item;
02821   int i;
02822 
02823   while (fgets (raw_in_buf, MLINE_SIZE, pinfo->in) != NULL)
02824     {
02825       /* Count the lines parsed */
02826       pinfo->line++;
02827 
02828       /* Make sure long lines are terminated */
02829       raw_in_buf[MLINE_SIZE] = 0;
02830 
02831       /* Detect lines that are too long */
02832       if (strlen (raw_in_buf) >= (MLINE_SIZE - 1))
02833         Mparse_error (pinfo,
02834                       "Line too long.  Max line length = %i", MLINE_SIZE - 1);
02835 
02836       /* Do preprocessing on line read in (Substitute in $name$ values) */
02837       L_preprocess_line (pinfo, raw_in_buf, in_buf, MLINE_SIZE);
02838 
02839       /* Skip blank lines (and comments) */
02840       if (in_buf[0] == 0)
02841         continue;
02842 
02843       ptr = in_buf;
02844       while (*ptr != 0)
02845         {
02846           item = (Mparse_Item *) L_alloc (Mparse_Item_pool);
02847 
02848           /* Read string into item */
02849           if (*ptr == '"')
02850             {
02851               /* Skip open quote */
02852               ptr++;
02853 
02854               /* Read in info between quotes */
02855               for (i = 0; i < MITEM_SIZE; i++)
02856                 {
02857                   /* Error if hit end of buffer before end quote */
02858                   if (ptr[i] == 0)
02859                     Mparse_error (pinfo,
02860                                   "Quoted string '%s' missing end quote",
02861                                   ptr);
02862 
02863                   /* Stop as soon as hit end quote */
02864                   if (ptr[i] != '"')
02865                     item->buf[i] = ptr[i];
02866                   else
02867                     break;
02868                 }
02869 
02870               /* Warn of too long names */
02871               if (i >= MITEM_SIZE)
02872                 Mparse_error (pinfo,
02873                               "Item too long. Max item length = %i",
02874                               MITEM_SIZE - 1);
02875 
02876               /* Terminate item buf */
02877               item->buf[i] = 0;
02878 
02879               /* Advance ptr to just after end of string */
02880               ptr += i;
02881 
02882               /* Advance past end quote */
02883               ptr++;
02884 
02885               /* Strip trailing whitespace */
02886               while (Misspace (*ptr))
02887                 ptr++;
02888             }
02889           /* Read a name into item */
02890           else if (isalpha (*ptr) || (*ptr == '_'))
02891             {
02892               /* Put first character into buf */
02893               item->buf[0] = *ptr;
02894 
02895               /* Read rest of name */
02896               for (i = 1; i < MITEM_SIZE; i++)
02897                 {
02898                   /* Stop as soon as hit non letter or digit or _ */
02899                   if (isalnum (ptr[i]) || (ptr[i] == '_'))
02900                     item->buf[i] = ptr[i];
02901                   else
02902                     break;
02903                 }
02904 
02905               /* Warn of too long names */
02906               if (i >= MITEM_SIZE)
02907                 Mparse_error (pinfo,
02908                               "Item too long. Max item length = %i",
02909                               MITEM_SIZE - 1);
02910 
02911               /* Terminate item buf */
02912               item->buf[i] = 0;
02913 
02914               /* Advance ptr to just after end of string */
02915               ptr += i;
02916 
02917               /* Strip trailing whitespace */
02918               while (Misspace (*ptr))
02919                 ptr++;
02920             }
02921           /* Read a signed number into item */
02922           else if (isdigit (*ptr) || ((*ptr == '-') && isdigit (ptr[1])))
02923             {
02924               /* Put first character into buf */
02925               item->buf[0] = *ptr;
02926 
02927               /* Read rest of number */
02928               for (i = 1; i < MITEM_SIZE; i++)
02929                 {
02930                   /* Stop as soon as hit non letter or digit */
02931                   if (isdigit (ptr[i]))
02932                     item->buf[i] = ptr[i];
02933                   else
02934                     break;
02935                 }
02936 
02937               /* Warn of too long names */
02938               if (i >= MITEM_SIZE)
02939                 Mparse_error (pinfo,
02940                               "Item too long. Max item length = %i",
02941                               MITEM_SIZE - 1);
02942 
02943               /* Terminate item buf */
02944               item->buf[i] = 0;
02945 
02946               /* Advance ptr to just after end of string */
02947               ptr += i;
02948 
02949               /* Strip trailing whitespace */
02950               while (Misspace (*ptr))
02951                 ptr++;
02952             }
02953           /* Read '..' into item */
02954           else if ((ptr[0] == '.') && (ptr[1] == '.'))
02955             {
02956               strcpy (item->buf, "..");
02957               ptr += 2;
02958 
02959               /* Strip trailing whitespace */
02960               while (Misspace (*ptr))
02961                 ptr++;
02962 
02963             }
02964           /* Otherwise read a single character into item */
02965           else
02966             {
02967               item->buf[0] = *ptr;
02968               item->buf[1] = 0;
02969               ptr++;
02970 
02971               /* Strip trailing whitespace */
02972               while (Misspace (*ptr))
02973                 ptr++;
02974             }
02975 
02976           /* Add item to parsed list */
02977           item->next = NULL;
02978           if (pinfo->tail == NULL)
02979             pinfo->head = item;
02980           else
02981             pinfo->tail->next = item;
02982           pinfo->tail = item;
02983           pinfo->queue_size++;
02984         }
02985       /* Parsed a line, return 0 */
02986       return (0);
02987     }
02988 
02989   /* Must be at end of file if reached here */
02990   return (EOF);
02991 }
02992 
02993 int
02994 Misspace (char ch)
02995 {
02996   if ((ch == ',') || isspace (ch))
02997     return (1);
02998   else
02999     return (0);
03000 }
03001 
03002 /*
03003  * Strips leading and trailing whitespace and comments.
03004  * Modifies buffer contents.
03005  */
03006 char *
03007 Mstrip (char *buf)
03008 {
03009   int i;
03010 
03011   /* Strip leading white space */
03012   for (; (*buf != 0) && Misspace (*buf); buf++)
03013     ;
03014 
03015   /* Strip trailing white space, comments */
03016   for (i = 0; (buf[i] != 0) && (buf[i] != '#') && (buf[i] != '%'); i++)
03017     ;
03018   buf[i] = 0;
03019   for (i = i - 1; (i >= 0) && Misspace (buf[i]); i--)
03020     buf[i] = 0;
03021 
03022   return (buf);
03023 }
03024 
03025 Mparse_Info *
03026 create_mparse_info (char *name, Hmdes * hmdes)
03027 {
03028   Mparse_Info *pinfo;
03029   int pinfo_size, name_size;
03030 
03031   /* Allocate space for pinfo structure and name */
03032   pinfo_size = sizeof (Mparse_Info);
03033   name_size = strlen (name) + 1;
03034 
03035   if (((pinfo = (Mparse_Info *) malloc (pinfo_size)) == NULL) ||
03036       ((pinfo->file_name = (char *) malloc (name_size)) == NULL))
03037     H_punt ("create_mparse_info: out of memory");
03038 
03039   /* Open passed name for reading */
03040   if ((pinfo->in = fopen (name, "r")) == NULL)
03041     H_punt ("Unable to open hmdes file '%s' for reading", name);
03042 
03043   /* Initialize the rest of the structure */
03044   strcpy (pinfo->file_name, name);
03045   strcpy (pinfo->section_name, "before any");
03046   pinfo->line = 0;
03047   pinfo->head = NULL;
03048   pinfo->tail = NULL;
03049   pinfo->queue_size = 0;
03050   pinfo->hmdes = hmdes;
03051 
03052   return (pinfo);
03053 }
03054 
03055 /* Prints a warning message showing where the parse warning was,
03056  * and returns
03057  */
03058 void
03059 Mparse_warn (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *fmt, ...)
03060 {
03061   va_list ap;
03062 
03063   va_start (ap, fmt);
03064   fprintf (stderr, "Warning (%s line %i, %s declaration):\n    ",
03065            pinfo->file_name, pinfo->line, pinfo->section_name);
03066   vfprintf (stderr, fmt, ap);
03067   va_end (ap);
03068 
03069   fprintf (stderr, "\n\n");
03070 }
03071 
03072 /* 
03073  * Prints a error message showing where the parse error was,
03074  * but delays punting by incrementing fatal error count;
03075  */
03076 void
03077 Mparse_fatal (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *fmt, ...)
03078 {
03079   va_list ap;
03080 
03081   va_start (ap, fmt);
03082   fprintf (stderr, "Error (%s line %i, %s declaration):\n    ",
03083            pinfo->file_name, pinfo->line, pinfo->section_name);
03084   vfprintf (stderr, fmt, ap);
03085   va_end (ap);
03086 
03087   fprintf (stderr, "\n\n");
03088   fatal_parse_errors++;
03089 }
03090 
03091 /* Punts with an error message showing where the parse error was */
03092 void
03093 Mparse_error (Mparse_Info * pinfo, char *fmt, ...)
03094 {
03095   va_list ap;
03096 
03097   va_start (ap, fmt);
03098   fprintf (stderr, "Error (%s line %i, %s declaration):\n    ",
03099            pinfo->file_name, pinfo->line, pinfo->section_name);
03100   vfprintf (stderr, fmt, ap);
03101   va_end (ap);
03102 
03103   fprintf (stderr, "\n\n");
03104   exit (1);
03105 }
03106 
03107 int
03108 Mmatch (char *s1, char *s2)
03109 {
03110   for (; *s1 != 0; s1++, s2++)
03111     {
03112       if (toupper (*s1) != toupper (*s2))
03113         return (0);
03114     }
03115 
03116   if (*s2 != 0)
03117     return (0);
03118   else
03119     return (1);
03120 }
03121 
03122 void
03123 associate_reg_files (Hmdes * hmdes)
03124 {
03125   Msymbol *set_node;
03126   Hmdes_IO_Set *IO_set;
03127   Msymbol_Table *prev_def;
03128   char *val_str, *end_ptr;
03129   char name_buf[MITEM_SIZE + 5];        /* Max possible size for name */
03130   int num_found, num_not_found, num_bad, num_redefs;
03131   int prev_val;
03132   char *prev_str;
03133   int i;
03134 
03135   num_found = 0;
03136   num_not_found = 0;
03137   num_bad = 0;
03138   num_redefs = 0;
03139 
03140   for (set_node = hmdes->IO_sets->head; set_node != NULL;
03141        set_node = set_node->next_linear)
03142     {
03143       IO_set = (Hmdes_IO_Set *) set_node->ptr;
03144 
03145       prev_def = NULL;
03146       prev_val = -1;
03147       prev_str = "";
03148 
03149 
03150       /* Prepend MDES_OPERAND_ to the front of the register file name */
03151       sprintf (name_buf, "MDES_OPERAND_%s", IO_set->name);
03152 
03153       /* Search all header files for symbol */
03154       for (i = 0; i < num_header_files; i++)
03155         {
03156           val_str = Mfind_symbol (header_table[i].table, name_buf);
03157 
03158           if (val_str == NULL)
03159             continue;
03160 
03161           /* Try to convert to an int */
03162           IO_set->external_id = strtol (val_str, &end_ptr, 0);
03163 
03164           if (*end_ptr != 0)
03165             {
03166               fprintf (stderr,
03167                        "Error: %s value '%s' from %s is not an int\n",
03168                        IO_set->name, val_str, header_table[i].table->name);
03169               num_bad++;
03170               IO_set->external_id = -1;
03171             }
03172           else if (IO_set->external_id < 0)
03173             {
03174               fprintf (stderr,
03175                        "Error for IO_set %s: %s defines as %i, "
03176                        "cannot be negative\n",
03177                        IO_set->name, header_table[i].table->name,
03178                        IO_set->external_id);
03179               num_bad++;
03180               IO_set->external_id = -1;
03181             }
03182 
03183           if (prev_def == NULL)
03184             {
03185               prev_def = header_table[i].table;
03186               prev_val = IO_set->external_id;
03187               prev_str = val_str;
03188             }
03189           else
03190             {
03191               if (prev_val != IO_set->external_id)
03192                 {
03193                   fprintf (stderr,
03194                            "Error for IO_set %s: %s defines as %s, "
03195                            "%s defines as %s\n",
03196                            IO_set->name, header_table[i].table->name,
03197                            val_str, prev_def->name, prev_str);
03198                   num_redefs++;
03199                 }
03200             }
03201 
03202         }
03203 
03204       if ((prev_def == NULL) || (IO_set->external_id == -1))
03205         {
03206           num_not_found++;
03207           fprintf (stderr, "IO_set %-11s not mapped to an external id\n",
03208                    IO_set->name);
03209         }
03210       else
03211         {
03212           fprintf (stderr, "IO_set %-11s mapped to %2i\n",
03213                    IO_set->name, IO_set->external_id);
03214           num_found++;
03215         }
03216 
03217     }
03218   if ((num_bad != 0) || (num_redefs != 0))
03219     {
03220       fprintf (stderr, "Cannot continue: %i IO_Sets with bad values\n",
03221                num_bad);
03222       fprintf (stderr, "               : %i invalid redefinitions\n",
03223                num_redefs);
03224       fprintf (stderr, "Header files scanned:\n");
03225       for (i = 0; i < num_header_files; i++)
03226         fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", header_table[i].table->name);
03227       exit (1);
03228 
03229     }
03230   fprintf (stderr,
03231            "IO_set specifiers: %3i found     %3i not found\n",
03232            num_found, num_not_found);
03233 }
03234 
03235 void
03236 associate_opcodes (Hmdes * hmdes)
03237 {
03238   int num_found, num_not_found, num_bad, num_redefs;
03239   Msymbol *op_node;
03240   char *val_str, *end_ptr;
03241   Hmdes_Operation *op;
03242   int i;
03243   Msymbol_Table *prev_def;
03244   int prev_val;
03245   char *prev_str;
03246 
03247   num_found = 0;
03248   num_not_found = 0;
03249   num_bad = 0;
03250   num_redefs = 0;
03251 
03252   for (op_node = hmdes->operations->head; op_node != NULL;
03253        op_node = op_node->next_linear)
03254     {
03255       op = (Hmdes_Operation *) op_node->ptr;
03256 
03257       prev_def = NULL;
03258       prev_val = -1;
03259       prev_str = "";
03260 
03261       /* Search all header files for symbol */
03262       for (i = 0; i < num_header_files; i++)
03263         {
03264           val_str = Mfind_symbol (header_table[i].table, op->name);
03265 
03266           if (val_str == NULL)
03267             continue;
03268 
03269           /* Try to convert to an int */
03270           op->id = strtol (val_str, &end_ptr, 0);
03271 
03272           if (*end_ptr != 0)
03273             {
03274               fprintf (stderr,
03275                        "Error: %s value '%s' from %s is not an int\n",
03276                        op->name, val_str, header_table[i].table->name);
03277               num_bad++;
03278               op->id = -1;
03279             }
03280           else if (op->id < 0)
03281             {
03282               fprintf (stderr,
03283                        "Error for operation %s: %s defines as %i, "
03284                        "cannot be negative\n",
03285                        op->name, header_table[i].table->name, op->id);
03286               num_bad++;
03287               op->id = -1;
03288             }
03289           if (prev_def == NULL)
03290             {
03291               prev_def = header_table[i].table;
03292               prev_val = op->id;
03293               prev_str = val_str;
03294             }
03295           else
03296             {
03297               if (prev_val != op->id)
03298                 {
03299                   fprintf (stderr,
03300                            "Error for operation %s: %s defined as %s, "
03301                            "%s defined as %s\n",
03302                            op->name, header_table[i].table->name,
03303                            val_str, prev_def->name, prev_str);
03304                   num_redefs++;
03305                 }
03306             }
03307 
03308         }
03309       if (prev_def == NULL)
03310         {
03311           num_not_found++;
03312           fprintf (stderr, "warning: %s not found in C header files\n",
03313                    op->name);
03314         }
03315       else
03316         num_found++;
03317     }
03318 
03319   if ((num_bad != 0) || (num_not_found != 0) || (num_redefs != 0))
03320     {
03321       fprintf (stderr,
03322                "Cannot continue: %i op_names not found\n", num_not_found);
03323       fprintf (stderr, "                 %i with bad values\n", num_bad);
03324       fprintf (stderr,
03325                "                 %i invalid redefinitions\n", num_redefs);
03326       fprintf (stderr, "Header files scanned:\n");
03327       for (i = 0; i < num_header_files; i++)
03328         fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", header_table[i].table->name);
03329       exit (1);
03330     }
03331 }
03332 
03333 /* 
03334  * Clears an bit mask of 'size' words
03335  */
03336 void
03337 clear_mask (int *mask, int size)
03338 {
03339   int i;
03340   for (i = 0; i < size; i++)
03341     mask[i] = 0;
03342 }
03343 
03344 /*
03345  * Sets specified bit in mask
03346  * Assumes mask an array of 32 bits of size MAX_MASK_SIZE;
03347  */
03348 void
03349 set_mask_bit (int *mask, unsigned int bit)
03350 {
03351   unsigned int index, offset;
03352   index = bit >> 5;
03353   if (index >= MAX_MASK_SIZE)
03354     H_punt ("set_mask_bit: index (%i) > MAX_MASK_SIZE (%i)",
03355             index, MAX_MASK_SIZE);
03356   offset = bit & 0x1F;
03357   if (offset > 31)
03358     H_punt ("set_mask_bit; offset (%i) > 32", offset);
03359   mask[index] |= (1 << offset);
03360 }
03361 
03362 /* 
03363  * Prints the mask to out, starting with highest numbered bits.
03364  * (Ie. prints out mask in reverse array order.)
03365  */
03366 void
03367 print_mask (FILE * out, int *mask, int size)
03368 {
03369   int i;
03370 
03371   for (i = size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
03372     {
03373       fprintf (out, "%08x ", mask[i]);
03374     }
03375 }
03376 
03377 /*
03378  * Writes res_node output for res_list
03379  * Used by write_lmdes
03380  */
03381 void
03382 write_res_node (FILE * out, int mask_size, Hmdes_Res_Node * res_node)
03383 {
03384   int mask[MAX_MASK_SIZE], pred_mask[MAX_MASK_SIZE];
03385   Hmdes_Res_Option *res_option;
03386 
03387   if (res_node->num_options <= 0)
03388     H_punt ("write_res_node: res_node->num_options = %i\n",
03389             res_node->num_options);
03390 
03391   fprintf (out, "  %2i %2i %2i %i\n",
03392            res_node->start_usage, res_node->end_usage,
03393            res_node->num_options, res_node->flags);
03394   for (res_option = res_node->head; res_option != NULL;
03395        res_option = res_option->next)
03396     {
03397       fprintf (out, "  ");
03398       clear_mask (mask, mask_size);
03399       set_mask_bit (mask, res_option->subscript->id);
03400       print_mask (out, mask, mask_size);
03401       fprintf (out, "  ");
03402       clear_mask (pred_mask, mask_size);
03403       /* Currently, none of these bits can be set */
03404       print_mask (out, pred_mask, mask_size);
03405       fprintf (out, "\n");
03406     }
03407 }
03408 
03409 /*
03410  * Writes low-level mdes file to the file specified
03411  */
03412 void
03413 write_lmdes (Hmdes * hmdes, FILE * out)
03414 {
03415   int i, mask_size;
03416   int mask[MAX_MASK_SIZE];
03417   char res_buf[MITEM_SIZE + 20];
03418   Msymbol *symbol;
03419   Hmdes_IO_Node *IO_node;
03420   Hmdes_IO_Set *IO_set;
03421   Hmdes_IO_Item *IO_item;
03422   Hmdes_Res_Sub *res_sub;
03423   Hmdes_Resource *resource;
03424   Hmdes_Resource *slots_avail;
03425   Hmdes_Res_Option *res_option;
03426   Hmdes_Res_Node *res_node;
03427   Hmdes_Res_List *res_list;
03428   Hmdes_Latency *latency;
03429   Hmdes_Class_Node *class_node;
03430   Hmdes_Operation_Node *op_node;
03431   Hmdes_Operation *op;
03432   Hmdes_Operation **op_table;
03433   int alt_count, max_opcode, max_set_id;
03434   int num_RU_entries_required, cycles_spanned;
03435   int error_count;
03436   int total_name_len;
03437   int total_slots;
03438   int total_rused;
03439   int total_options;
03440   int total_alts;
03441 
03442 
03443   fprintf (out, "Lmdes Version 3\n\n");
03444 
03445   /* Get the slots available */
03446   slots_avail = (Hmdes_Resource *) Mfind_symbol (hmdes->resources, "slot");
03447   if (slots_avail == NULL)
03448     {
03449       H_punt ("No slots declared, should have been detected earlier");
03450     }
03451 
03452   /* Print out any paramaters that we need */
03453   fprintf (out, "proc_model: %2i\n", hmdes->processor_model);
03454 
03455   /*
03456    * Print out number of each operand type, the max slot number,
03457    * and the number of slots in the machine
03458    */
03459   fprintf (out, "sizes: %2i %2i %2i %2i %2i %2i %2i \n\n",
03460            hmdes->max_pred_operands, hmdes->max_dest_operands,
03461            hmdes->max_src_operands, hmdes->max_src_syncs,
03462            hmdes->max_dest_syncs, hmdes->max_slot,
03463            slots_avail->num_subscripts);
03464 
03465   mask_size = ((hmdes->reg_file->entry_count - 1) / 32) + 1;
03466   if (mask_size > MAX_MASK_SIZE)
03467     H_punt ("write_lmdes: rmask_size (%i) > MAX_MASK_SIXE (%i)",
03468             mask_size, MAX_MASK_SIZE);
03469 
03470   /* Calc the total name buffer space needed for entire IO_Set_array.
03471    * also calc max external_id for IO_set
03472    */
03473   total_name_len = 0;
03474   max_set_id = -1;
03475   for (symbol = hmdes->IO_sets->head; symbol != NULL;
03476        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
03477     {
03478       IO_set = (Hmdes_IO_Set *) symbol->ptr;
03479       total_name_len += strlen (IO_set->name) + 1;
03480       if (IO_set->external_id > max_set_id)
03481         max_set_id = IO_set->external_id;
03482 
03483     }
03484 
03485   if (max_set_id == -1)
03486     H_punt ("Error: None of the IO_sets have external id's");
03487 
03488   fprintf (out, "IO_Sets_begin  %1i %5i %5i %5i %5i %6i\n", mask_size,
03489            hmdes->reg_file->entry_count, hmdes->IO_sets->entry_count,
03490            hmdes->null_set->external_id, max_set_id, total_name_len);
03491 
03492   for (symbol = hmdes->IO_sets->head; symbol != NULL;
03493        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
03494     {
03495       IO_set = (Hmdes_IO_Set *) symbol->ptr;
03496       clear_mask (mask, mask_size);
03497       for (IO_node = IO_set->head; IO_node != NULL; IO_node = IO_node->next)
03498         {
03499           set_mask_bit (mask, IO_node->reg_file->id);
03500         }
03501       fprintf (out, "%3i %3i %-11s ", IO_set->id, IO_set->external_id,
03502                IO_set->name);
03503       print_mask (out, mask, mask_size);
03504       fprintf (out, "\n");
03505     }
03506   fprintf (out, "IO_Sets_end\n\n");
03507 
03508   /* Calc the total name buffer space needed for entire IO_Item_array */
03509   total_name_len = 0;
03510   for (symbol = hmdes->IO_items->head; symbol != NULL;
03511        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
03512     {
03513       IO_item = (Hmdes_IO_Item *) symbol->ptr;
03514       total_name_len += strlen (IO_item->name) + 1;
03515     }
03516 
03517   fprintf (out, "IO_Items_begin  %3i %6i\n", hmdes->IO_items->entry_count,
03518            total_name_len);
03519 
03520   for (symbol = hmdes->IO_items->head; symbol != NULL;
03521        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
03522     {
03523       IO_item = (Hmdes_IO_Item *) symbol->ptr;
03524 
03525       fprintf (out, "%3i %-11s ", IO_item->id, IO_item->name);
03526 
03527       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_pred_operands; i++)
03528         {
03529           if (IO_item->pred[i] == NULL)
03530             H_punt ("pred IO_item NULL. Algorthm error");
03531           else
03532             fprintf (out, "%2i ", IO_item->pred[i]->id);
03533         }
03534       fprintf (out, " ");
03535       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_dest_operands; i++)
03536         {
03537           if (IO_item->dest[i] == NULL)
03538             H_punt ("dest IO_item NULL. Algorthm error");
03539           else
03540             fprintf (out, "%2i ", IO_item->dest[i]->id);
03541         }
03542       fprintf (out, " ");
03543       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_src_operands; i++)
03544         {
03545           if (IO_item->src[i] == NULL)
03546             H_punt ("src IO_item NULL. Algorthm error");
03547           else
03548             fprintf (out, "%2i ", IO_item->src[i]->id);
03549         }
03550       fprintf (out, "\n");
03551     }
03552   fprintf (out, "IO_Items_end\n\n");
03553 
03554 
03555   /* Calc the total name buffer space needed for entire resource_array, */
03556   total_name_len = 0;
03557   for (symbol = hmdes->resources->head; symbol != NULL;
03558        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
03559     {
03560       resource = (Hmdes_Resource *) symbol->ptr;
03561       for (res_sub = resource->head; res_sub != NULL; res_sub = res_sub->next)
03562         {
03563           sprintf (res_buf, "%s[%i]", resource->name, res_sub->subscript);
03564           total_name_len += strlen (res_buf) + 1;
03565         }
03566     }
03567 
03568   fprintf (out, "Resources_begin  %3i %6i\n", hmdes->num_resources,
03569            total_name_len);
03570   for (symbol = hmdes->resources->head; symbol != NULL;
03571        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
03572     {
03573       resource = (Hmdes_Resource *) symbol->ptr;
03574 
03575       for (res_sub = resource->head; res_sub != NULL; res_sub = res_sub->next)
03576         {
03577           sprintf (res_buf, "%s[%i]", resource->name, res_sub->subscript);
03578           fprintf (out, "%3i %-11s\n", res_sub->id, res_buf);
03579         }
03580     }
03581   fprintf (out, "Resources_end\n\n");
03582 
03583 
03584   mask_size = ((hmdes->num_resources - 1) / 32) + 1;
03585   if (mask_size <= 0)
03586     H_punt ("write_lmdes: resource mask size (%i) too small", mask_size);
03587   if (mask_size >= MAX_MASK_SIZE)
03588     H_punt ("write_lmdes: resource mask size (%i) >= MAX (%i)",
03589             mask_size, MAX_MASK_SIZE);
03590 
03591   /* Calc the total name buffer space needed for entire ResList_array,
03592    * Also, the total number of resources used, and the total
03593    * number of options (multiple options per resource is allowed)
03594    */
03595   total_name_len = 0;
03596   total_rused = 0;
03597   total_options = 0;
03598   total_slots = 0;
03599   for (symbol = hmdes->res_lists->head; symbol != NULL;
03600        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
03601     {
03602       res_list = (Hmdes_Res_List *) symbol->ptr;
03603       total_name_len += strlen (res_list->name) + 1;
03604       total_rused += res_list->size + 1 /* for slot options */ ;
03605       total_slots += res_list->slot_options->num_options;
03606       total_options += res_list->slot_options->num_options;
03607       for (res_node = res_list->head; res_node != NULL;
03608            res_node = res_node->next)
03609         {
03610           total_options += res_node->num_options;
03611         }
03612     }
03613 
03614   fprintf (out, "ResList_begin  %3i %5i %5i %5i %2i %6i\n",
03615            hmdes->res_lists->entry_count,
03616            total_rused, total_slots, total_options, mask_size,
03617            total_name_len);
03618 
03619   for (symbol = hmdes->res_lists->head; symbol != NULL;
03620        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
03621     {
03622       res_list = (Hmdes_Res_List *) symbol->ptr;
03623 
03624       /* Calculate how many RU entries will be needed if this
03625        * alternative is scheduled.  One RU entry is needed
03626        * per option per cycle.
03627        */
03628       num_RU_entries_required = 1;      /* For slot entry */
03629       for (res_node = res_list->head; res_node != NULL;
03630            res_node = res_node->next)
03631         {
03632           cycles_spanned = (res_node->end_usage - res_node->start_usage) + 1;
03633           if (cycles_spanned < 1)
03634             H_punt ("write_lmdes: cycles_spanned (%i) < 1", cycles_spanned);
03635           num_RU_entries_required += cycles_spanned;
03636         }
03637 
03638       fprintf (out, "%2i %-11s %4i %4i %4i\n", res_list->id, res_list->name,
03639                res_list->size + 1 /* for slot options */ ,
03640                res_list->slot_options->num_options, num_RU_entries_required);
03641 
03642       /* Print out the slot options (slot id's)  for this res list */
03643       fprintf (out, "  ");
03644       for (res_option = res_list->slot_options->head; res_option != NULL;
03645            res_option = res_option->next)
03646         {
03647           fprintf (out, "%2i ", res_option->subscript->subscript);
03648         }
03649       fprintf (out, "\n");
03650 
03651       /* Print out slot options */
03652       write_res_node (out, mask_size, res_list->slot_options);
03653 
03654       /* Print out the resource list */
03655       for (res_node = res_list->head; res_node != NULL;
03656            res_node = res_node->next)
03657         {
03658           write_res_node (out, mask_size, res_node);
03659         }
03660     }
03661   fprintf (out, "ResList_end\n\n");
03662 
03663   /* Calc the total name buffer space needed for entire latency_array */
03664   total_name_len = 0;
03665   for (symbol = hmdes->latencies->head; symbol != NULL;
03666        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
03667     {
03668       latency = (Hmdes_Latency *) symbol->ptr;
03669       total_name_len += strlen (latency->name) + 1;
03670     }
03671 
03672   fprintf (out, "Latencies_begin  %3i %6i\n", hmdes->latencies->entry_count,
03673            total_name_len);
03674   for (symbol = hmdes->latencies->head; symbol != NULL;
03675        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
03676     {
03677       latency = (Hmdes_Latency *) symbol->ptr;
03678 
03679       fprintf (out, "%3i %-11s  %2i ", latency->id, latency->name,
03680                latency->exception);
03681       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_pred_operands; i++)
03682         {
03683           fprintf (out, "%2i ", latency->pred[i]);
03684         }
03685       fprintf (out, " ");
03686       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_dest_operands; i++)
03687         {
03688           fprintf (out, "%2i ", latency->dest[i]);
03689         }
03690       fprintf (out, " ");
03691       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_src_operands; i++)
03692         {
03693           fprintf (out, "%2i ", latency->src[i]);
03694         }
03695       fprintf (out, " ");
03696       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_src_syncs; i++)
03697         {
03698           fprintf (out, "%2i ", latency->sync_src[i]);
03699         }
03700       fprintf (out, " ");
03701       for (i = 0; i < hmdes->max_dest_syncs; i++)
03702         {
03703           fprintf (out, "%2i ", latency->sync_dest[i]);
03704         }
03705       fprintf (out, "\n");
03706     }
03707   fprintf (out, "Latencies_end\n\n");
03708 
03709   /* Calc the total name buffer space needed for entire operation_array */
03710   total_name_len = 0;
03711   for (symbol = hmdes->operations->head; symbol != NULL;
03712        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
03713     {
03714       op = (Hmdes_Operation *) symbol->ptr;
03715 
03716       total_name_len += strlen (op->name) + 1;
03717 
03718       for (op_node = op->head; op_node != NULL; op_node = op_node->next)
03719         {
03720           for (class_node = op_node->class->head; class_node != NULL;
03721                class_node = class_node->next)
03722             {
03723               total_name_len += strlen (op_node->asm_name) + 1;
03724             }
03725         }
03726     }
03727 
03728   /* Calculate max opcode and total num of alts */
03729   max_opcode = -1;
03730   total_alts = 0;
03731   for (symbol = hmdes->operations->head; symbol != NULL;
03732        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
03733     {
03734       op = (Hmdes_Operation *) symbol->ptr;
03735       if (op->id > max_opcode)
03736         max_opcode = op->id;
03737 
03738       /* I do not allow negative opcodes */
03739       if (op->id < 0)
03740         H_punt ("write_mdes: negative opcode (%i) for %s not allowed\n",
03741                 op->id, op->name);
03742 
03743       /*
03744        * Do not allow max opcode go above 16384 (just so we don't
03745        * allocate some huge array in lmdes.)  
03746        */
03747       if (op->id > 16384)
03748         H_punt ("write_mdes: opcode %i for %s > 16384\n", op->id, op->name);
03749 
03750       for (op_node = op->head; op_node != NULL; op_node = op_node->next)
03751         {
03752           for (class_node = op_node->class->head; class_node != NULL;
03753                class_node = class_node->next)
03754             {
03755               total_alts++;
03756             }
03757         }
03758     }
03759 
03760 
03761   /* Make sure there are not two operations with the same opcode */
03762   Malloc_struct ((void **) &op_table,
03763                  sizeof (Hmdes_Operation *) * (max_opcode + 1));
03764 
03765   /* Initialize op_table to NULL */
03766   for (i = 0; i <= max_opcode; i++)
03767     op_table[i] = NULL;
03768 
03769   /* Place all opcodes into table */
03770   error_count = 0;
03771   for (symbol = hmdes->operations->head; symbol != NULL;
03772        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
03773     {
03774       op = (Hmdes_Operation *) symbol->ptr;
03775 
03776       if (op_table[op->id] != NULL)
03777         {
03778           fprintf (stderr, "Error: %s and %s have the same opcode %i\n",
03779                    op_table[op->id]->name, op->name, op->id);
03780           error_count++;
03781         }
03782     }
03783   if (error_count != 0)
03784     H_punt ("Cannot continue: %i operations with conflicting opcodes",
03785             error_count);
03786 
03787   fprintf (out, "Operations_begin %5i %5i %5i %6i\n",
03788            hmdes->operations->entry_count, total_alts, max_opcode,
03789            total_name_len);
03790   for (symbol = hmdes->operations->head; symbol != NULL;
03791        symbol = symbol->next_linear)
03792     {
03793       op = (Hmdes_Operation *) symbol->ptr;
03794 
03795       alt_count = 0;
03796       for (op_node = op->head; op_node != NULL; op_node = op_node->next)
03797         {
03798           for (class_node = op_node->class->head; class_node != NULL;
03799                class_node = class_node->next)
03800             {
03801               alt_count++;
03802             }
03803         }
03804 
03805       fprintf (out, "%4i %-11s %3i %08x\n", op->id, op->name,
03806                alt_count, op->op_flags.bit_version);
03807 
03808       for (op_node = op->head; op_node != NULL; op_node = op_node->next)
03809         {
03810           for (class_node = op_node->class->head; class_node != NULL;
03811                class_node = class_node->next)
03812             {
03813 
03814               fprintf (out, "  %-11s %08x  %3i %3i %3i\n",
03815                        op_node->asm_name, op_node->mdes_flags.bit_version,
03816                        class_node->io_item->id,
03817                        class_node->res_list->id, class_node->latency->id);
03818             }
03819         }
03820     }
03821   fprintf (out, "Operations_end\n\n");
03822 }
03823 
03824 
03825 /* Library of c functions to test out C++ linking capability */
03826 
03827 void
03828 H_punt (char *fmt, ...)
03829 {
03830   va_list ap;
03831 
03832   va_start (ap, fmt);
03833   vfprintf (stderr, fmt, ap);
03834   va_end (ap);
03835 
03836   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
03837   exit (1);
03838 }
